content: स तां पुष्करिणीं गत्वा पद्मोत्पलझषाकुलाम्। रामस्सौमित्रि सहितो विललापाकुलेन्द्रियः।।4.1.1।।
explanation: Arriving with Laksmana at the lake filled with lotuses, lilies and fishes, Rama, his senses oppressed, burst into tears.

content: तस्य दृष्ट्वैव तां हर्षादिन्द्रियाणि चकम्पिरे।स कामवशमापन्नस्सौमित्रिमिदमब्रवीत्।।4.1.2।।
explanation: He was glad to see it but sad at the thought of Sita. His passion stirred, his senses shaken, he said this to Saumitri:

content: सौमित्रे शोभते पम्पा वैदूर्यविमलोदका।फुल्लपद्मोत्पलवती शोभिता विविधैर्द्रुमैः।।4.1.3।।
explanation: 'O Saumitri Pampa looks beautiful with its water clear as vaidurya, its lilies and lotuses in full bloom and its trees in all their variety.

content: सौमित्रे पश्य पम्पायाः काननं शुभदर्शनम्।यत्र राजन्ति शैला वा द्रुमास्सशिखरा इव।।4.1.4।।
explanation: 'O Saumitri look at the pleasant forest around Pampa where trees stand splendid like mountainpeaks.

content: मां तु शोकाभिसन्तप्तं माधवः पीडयन्ति वै।भरतस्य च दुःखेन वैदेह्या हरणेन च।।4.1.5।।
explanation: Already saddened due to the abduction of Sita and plight of Bharata, I am tormented by Spring.

content: शोकार्तस्यापि मे पम्पा शोभते चित्रकानना। व्यवकीर्णा बहुविधैः पुष्पैश्शीतोदका शिवा।।4.1.6।।
explanation: Though stricken with grief, I feel so delighted to see the auspicious Pampa with its wonderful forest and cool water scattered with flowers.

content: नलिनैरपि सञ्छन्ना ह्यत्यर्थशुभदर्शना।सर्पव्यालानुचरिता मृगद्विजसमाकुला।।4.1.7।।
explanation: Abounding in lotuses, birds and beasts and vicious serpents moving about, it looks splendid indeed.

content: अधिकं प्रविभात्येतन्नीलपीतं तु शाद्वलम्।द्रुमाणां विविधैः पुष्पैः परिस्तोमैरिवार्पितम्।।4.1.8।।
explanation: The bluishyellow grass, dotted with different kinds of flowers fallen from the trees shines like a carpet spread.

content: पुष्पभारसमृद्धानि शिखराणि समन्ततः।लताभिः पुष्पिताग्राभिरुपगूढानि सर्वशः।।4.1.9।।
explanation: Entwined with flowering creepers the treetops are covered all over with rich loads of flowers.

content: सुखानिलोऽयं सौमित्रे कालः प्रचुरमन्मथः।गन्धवान्सुरभिर्मासो जातपुष्पफलद्रुमः।।4.1.10।।
explanation: 'O Saumitri it is the season of spring. The trees are laden with fruits and fragrant flowers. Ecstatic blows the gentle freeze.

content: पश्य रूपाणि सौमित्रे वनानां पुष्पशालिनाम्।सृजतां पुष्पवर्षाणि तोयं तोयमुचामिव।।4.1.11।।
explanation: 'Look at the flowering trees sending showers of flowers like water dropping from the clouds, O Saumitri

content: प्रस्तरेषु च रम्येषु विविधाः काननद्रुमाः।वायुवेगप्रचलिताः पुष्पैरवकिरन्ति गाम्।।4.1.12।।
explanation: Various forest trees shaken by the force of the wind scatter flowers on the beautiful rocky surface of earth.

content:
पतितैः पतमानैश्च पादपस्थैश्च मारुतः।

कुसुमैः पश्य सौमित्रे क्रीडन्निव समन्ततः।।4.1.13।।
explanation: O Saumitri! look, the breeze appears to be playing with the flowers; that are fallen and that are still on the trees.

content:
विक्षिपन्विविधाश्शाखा नगानां कुसुमोत्कचाः।

मारुतश्चलितस्थानैष्षट्पदैरनुगीयते।।4.1.14।।
explanation: "As the wind shakes the flowers off the branches of various trees the bees bumble in tune with the (whistling) wind.

content:
मत्तकोकिलसन्नादैर्नर्तयन्निव पादपान्।

शैलकन्दरनिष्क्रान्तः प्रगीत इव चानिलः।।4.1.15।।
explanation: "As if the trees are dancing to the music of the cuckoos and to the sound of the wind coming out of the mountain-caves.

content:
तेन विक्षिपताऽत्यर्थं पवनेन समन्ततः।

अमी संसक्तशाखाग्रा ग्रथिता इव पादपाः।।4.1.16।।
explanation: "Shaken by the strong wind all over, the tops of trees look as if they are knitted together.

content: स एष सुखसंस्पर्शो वाति चन्दनशीतलः।गन्धमभ्यवहन्पुण्यं श्रमापनयनोऽनिलः।।4.1.17।।
explanation: 'The gentle touch of the breeze that blows, cool like sandalwood, full of pure fragrance, takes away the fatigue of the body.

content: अमी पवनविक्षिप्ता विनदन्तीव पादपाः।षट्पदैरनुकूजन्तो वनेषु मधुगन्धिषु।।4.1.18।।
explanation: As if the trees are singing, swayed by the wind, while the bees in the forest, fragrant with honey, hum in tune.

content: गिरिप्रस्थेषु रम्येषु पुष्पवद्भिर्मनोरमैः।संसक्तशिखराश्शैला विराजन्ते महाद्रुमैः।।4.1.19।।
explanation: 'The huge trees in the scenic mountainranges look delightful with their blossoms touching the peaks.

content: पुष्पसञ्छन्नशिखरा मारुतोत्क्षेपचञ्चलाः।अमी मधुकरोत्तंसाः प्रगीता इव पादपाः।।4.1.20।।
explanation: With the tops of trees covered with flowers, the black bees hovering (humming) over them, the trees, shaken by the restless wind look like singers. (The trees with the top decked with flowers, the bees like black hair on the head swaying in the wind look like dancing and singing)

content: सुपुष्पितांस्तु पश्येमान्कर्णिकारांत्समन्ततः।हाटकप्रतिसञ्छन्नान्नरान्पीताम्बरानिव।।4.1.21।।
explanation: 'See these Karnikaras in full bloom all over, looking like people clad in yellow silk adorned with golden ornaments.

content: अयं वसन्तस्सौमित्रे नानाविहगनादितः।सीतया विप्रहीनस्य शोकसन्दीपनो मम।।4.1.22।।
explanation: 'O Saumitri this spring season resonating with the sounds of several kinds of birds, kindles my anguish as I am separated from Sita.

content: मां हि शोकसमाक्रान्तं सन्तापयति मन्मथः। हृष्टः प्रवदमानश्च ममाह्वयति कोकिलः।।4.1.23।।
explanation: 'Kandarpa (Cupid) torments me while I am already griefstricken. The Cuckoo with his challenging cheerfulness mocks me.

content: एष दात्यूहको हृष्टो रम्ये मां वननिर्झरे।प्रणदन्मन्मथाविष्टं शोचयिष्यति लक्ष्मण।।4.1.24।।
explanation: 'Lakshmana, while I am already lovestricken, the swamphen (gallinule, a marshbird) troubles me with its joyous cackles in the beautiful foreststream.

content: श्रुत्वैतस्य पुरा शब्दमाश्रमस्था मम प्रिया।मामाहूय प्रमुदिताः परमं प्रत्यनन्दत।।4.1.25।।
explanation: 'While in the hermitage in the past, my beloved was very glad to hear such sounds, invite me to join her and rejoice again.

content: एवं विचित्राः पतगा नानारावविराविणः।वृक्षगुल्मलताः पश्य सम्पतन्ति समन्ततः।।4.1.26।।
explanation: 'See, the different kinds of birds flying towards trees, shrubs and vines making wonderful sounds all over.

content: विमिश्रा विहगाः पुम्भिरात्मव्यूहाभिनन्दिताः। भृङ्गराजप्रमुदितास्सौमित्रे मधुरस्वनाः।।4.1.27।।
explanation: 'O Lakshmana the female birds praised by their flocks, are united with their male partners. Enjoying the sweet sounds of large black bees, they are singing melodiously.

content: दात्यूहरतिविक्रन्दैः पुंस्कोकिलरुतैरपि। स्वनन्ति पादपाश्चेमे ममानङ्गप्रदीपनाः।।4.1.28।।
explanation: These trees seem to enkindle my passion through all sorts of sounds like the loud cackle of swamphens and the sweet warble of the male cuckoos.

content: अशोकस्तबकाङ्गारष्षट्पदस्वननिःस्वनः। मां हि पल्लवताम्रार्चिर्वसन्ताग्निः प्रधक्ष्यति।।4.1.29।।
explanation: 'The fire of spring with clusters of Asoka flowers as its charcoal, its coppercoloured tender leaves as flames, the buzz of bees as its crackle will, as if, consume me.

content: न हि तां सूक्ष्मपक्ष्माक्षीं सुकेशीं मृदुभाषिणीम्। अपश्यतो मे सौमित्रे जीवितेऽस्ति प्रयोजनम्।।4.1.30।।
explanation: 'O Saumitri my life is meaningless if I cannot see my beloved Sita with her delicate eyelashes, beautiful locks of hair and her sweet voice.

content: अयं हि दयितस्तस्याः कालो रुचिरकाननः। कोकिलाकुलसीमान्तो दयिताया ममानघ।।4.1.31।।
explanation: 'O sinless one, the spring season is dear to my beloved Sita when the outskirts of the forest are filled with voices of the cockoo.

content: मन्मथाऽयाससम्भूतो वसन्तगुणवर्धितः। अयं मां धक्ष्यति क्षिप्रं शोकाग्निर्नचिरादिव।।4.1.32।।
explanation: 'The fire of grief ignited by Kandarpa (the god of love), enhanced by the effects of spring will certainly consume me soon.

content: अपश्यतस्तां दयितां पश्यतो रुचिरद्रुमान्। ममायमात्मप्रभवो भूयस्त्वमुपयास्यति।।4.1.33।।
explanation: 'Unable to see my beloved wife, the very sight of these lovely trees intensifies my love for her who shines resplendent in me.

content: अदृश्यमाना वैदेही शोकं वर्धयते मम। दृश्यमानो वसन्तश्च स्वेदसंसर्गदूषकः।।4.1.34।।
explanation: 'When in place of Vaidehi I see spring (with its cool breeze) that used to take away the sweat generated by sensual enjoyment, my sorrow is intensified.

content: मां ह्यद्य मृगशाबाक्षी चिन्ताशोकबलात्कृतम्। सन्तापयति सौमित्रे क्रूरश्चैत्रवनानिलः।।4.1.35।।
explanation: 'O Saumitri the cruel breeze of the spring forest torments me as I am now immersed in grief in the absence of my fawneyed beloved.

content: अमी मयूराश्शोभन्ते प्रनृत्यन्तस्ततस्ततः। स्वैः पक्षैः पवनोद्धूतैर्गवाक्षैः स्फाटिकैरिव।।4.1.36।।
explanation: 'Delightful are the peacocks dancing here and there, their feathers looking like crystal windows flung open by the wind.

content: शिखिनीभिः परिवृतास्ते एते मदमूर्छिताः। मन्मथाभिपरीतस्य मम मन्मथवर्धनाः।।4.1.37।।
explanation: 'The peacocks intoxicated with passion for the peahens surround them intensifying my longing (for Vaidehi).

content: पश्य लक्ष्मण नृत्यन्तं मयूरमुपनृत्यति। शिखिनी मन्मथार्तैषा भर्तारं गिरिसानुनि।।4.1.38।।
explanation: 'Look at the lovelorn peahen, excited by love, dancing on the moutain slope, O Lakshmana  Engrossed in love, she dances for wooing the peacock.

content: तामेव मन्मथाविष्टो मयूरोऽप्युपधावति। वितत्य रुचिरौ पक्षौ रुतैरुपहसन्निव।।4.1.39।।
explanation: 'Overwhelmed with love, the enchanted peacock, spreading his wings is running after her, making sounds, as though mocking her.

content: मयूरस्य वने नूनं रक्षसा न हृता प्रिया। तस्मान्नृत्यति रम्येषु वनेषु सह कान्तया।।4.1.40।।
explanation: 'The peacock's beloved, for sure, has not been abducted by the demon. Therefore, he is dancing in delight in the forest in the company of his beloved.

content: मम त्वयं विना वासः पुष्पमासे सुदुस्सहः। पश्य लक्ष्मण संरागः तिर्यग्योनिगतेष्वपि। यदेषा शिखिनी कामाद्भर्तारं रमतेऽन्तिके।।4.1.41।।
explanation: 'It is extremely unbearable for me to stay in the forest during this season of flowers (Spring). Look at the passion even among beasts and birds, O Lakshmana And craving for love, the peahen sports near her mate.

content: मामप्येवं विशालाक्षी जानकी जातसम्भ्रमा। मदनेनाभिवर्तेत यदि नाऽपहृता भवेत्।।4.1.42।।
explanation: 'Had the largeeyed Janaki not been stolen, she would have also paid advances to me in this manner with all her love and excitement.

content: पश्य लक्ष्मण पुष्पाणि निष्फलानि भवन्ति मे। पुष्पभारसमृद्धानां वनानां शिशिरात्यये।।4.1.43।।
रुचिराण्यपि पुष्पाणि पादपानामतिश्रिया। निष्फलानि महीं यान्ति समं मधुकरोत्करैः।।4.1.44।।
explanation: 'The trees look enchanting with flowers in full bloom, with bees hovering over them. But the flowers fruitlessly drop down on the ground.

content: नदन्ति कामं शकुना मुदितास्सङ्घशः कलम्। आह्वयन्त इवान्योन्यं कामोन्मादकरा मम।।4.1.45।।
वसन्तो यदि तत्रापि यत्र मे वसति प्रिया। नूनं परवशा सीता सापि शोचत्यहं यथा।।4.1.46।।
explanation: 'If spring reigns wherever my beloved Sita is, she must have been overwhelmed with similar sad feelings like me.

content: नूनं न तु वसन्तोऽतं देशं स्पृशति यत्र सा। कथं ह्यसितपद्माक्षी वर्तयेत्सा मया विना।।4.1.47।।
explanation: 'Spring must not have touched the place where she is now staying. Otherwise how could my Sita with eyes like blue lotus live without me?

content: अथवा वर्तते तत्र वसन्तो यत्र मे प्रिया।किं करिष्यति सुश्रोणी सा तु निर्भर्त्सिता परैः।।4.1.48।।
explanation: 'Or, if there is spring where my beloved lives, what can that lady of beautiful hips do, threatened by enemies.

content: श्यामा पद्मपलाशाक्षी मृदुपूर्वाभिभाषिणी। नूनं वसन्तमासाद्य परित्यक्ष्यति जीवितम्।।4.1.49।।
explanation: 'Eager to speak with her gentle voice, my young beloved, blessed with eyes like lotus petals, will certainly give up her life, unable to enjoy the spring.

content: दृढं हि हृदये बुद्धिर्मम सम्परिवर्तते। नालं वर्तयितुं सीता साध्वी मद्विरहं गता।।4.1.50।।
explanation: 'My mind makes me feel certain that Sita with her chastity might not be able to live separated from me.

content: मयि भावस्तु वैदेह्यास्तत्त्वतो विनिवेशितः। ममापि भावस्सीतायां सर्वथा विनिवेशितः।।4.1.51।।
explanation: 'Sita has her love truly fixed in me. My love for her is equally steadfast.

content: एष पुष्पवहो वायुस्सुखस्पर्शो हिमावहः। तां विचिन्तयतः कान्तां पावकप्रतिमो मम।।4.1.52।।
explanation: 'This cool breeze that carries the fragrance of flowers, that is gentle in its touch feels like fire when I think about my beautiful beloved.

content: सदा सुखमहं मन्ये यं पुरा सह सीतया। मारुतस्स विना सीतां शोकं वर्धयते मम।।4.1.53।।
explanation: 'The pleasant touch of the wind, which made me happy in the company of Sita intensifies my grief now in her absence.

content: तां विना विहङ्गो यः पक्षी प्रणदितस्तदा। वायसः पादपगतः प्रहृष्टमभिनर्दति।।4.1.54।।
explanation: 'The crow that cried unhappily flying in the sky as if to foretell my separation from Sita, is now on the tree, singing joyfully (suggesting my possible union with Sita).

content: एष वै तत्र वैदेह्या विहगः प्रतिहारकः। पक्षी मां तु विशालाक्ष्यास्समीपमुपनेष्यति।।4.1.55।।
explanation: 'The same crow attendant on Vaidehi there will take me to my largeeyed beloved.

content: शृणु लक्ष्मण सन्नादं वने मद्विवर्धनम्। पुष्पिताग्रेषु वृक्षेषु द्विजानामुपकूजताम्।।4.1.56।।
explanation: 'Losten, O Lakshmana to the sweet warblings of the birds on the blossoming treetops of the forest. My love for her (Sita) enhances with their sweet voices.

content: विक्षिप्तां पवनेनैतामसौ तिलकमञ्जरीम्। षट्पदस्सहसाऽभ्येति मदोद्धूतामिव प्रियाम्।।4.1.57।।
explanation: 'This honeybee is eager to approach the bunch of tilaka flowers in bloom scattered by the wind like a lover advancing towards his passionate beloved.

content: कामिनामयमत्यन्तमशोकश्शोकवर्धनः। स्तबकैः पवनोत्क्षिप्तैस्तर्जयन्निव मां स्थितः।।4.1.58।।
explanation: 'This asoka tree increases (by nature) the sorrow of lovers. Perhaps it make its presence felt in order to intimidate me with the clusters of its flowers scattered by the wind.

content: अमी लक्ष्मण दृश्यन्ते चूताः कुसुमशालिनः। विभ्रमोत्सिक्तमनसः साङ्गरागा नरा इव।।4.1.59।।
explanation: 'O Lakshmana these mangotrees full of blossoms appear like sexited men who have applied fragrant unguents to their bodies.

content: सौमित्रे पश्य पम्पायाश्चित्रासु वनराजिषु। किन्नरा नरशार्दूल विचरन्ति ततस्ततः।।4.1.60।।
explanation: 'O Saumitri O' tiger among men look at the kinnaras wandering here and there, in the wonderful forest around the Pampa lake.

content: इमानि शुभगन्धीनि पश्य लक्ष्मण सर्वशः। नलिनानि प्रकाशन्ते जले तरुणसूर्यवत्।।4.1.61।।
explanation: 'O Lakshmana look at these lotuses with fine fragrance all over the water glowing like the rising Sun.

content: एषा प्रसन्नसलिला पद्मनीलोत्पलायुता। हंसकारण्डवाकीर्णा पम्पा सौगन्धिकान्विता।।4.1.62।।
explanation: 'This Pampa with its water clear and fragrant with red and blue lotuses is filled with swans and geese.

content: जले तरुणसूर्याभैष्षट्पदाहतकेसरैः। पङ्कजैश्शोभते पम्पा समन्तादभिसंवृता।।4.1.63।।
explanation: 'Lake Pampa shines with lotuses with bees on their filaments like the rising sun.

content: चक्रवाकयुता नित्यं चित्रप्रस्तवनान्तरा। मातङ्गमृगयूथैश्च शोभते सलिलार्थिभिः।।4.1.64।।
explanation: 'Frequented by the Chakravakas and surrounded by the wonderful forest with thirsty elephants and deer this Pampa looks beautiful.

content: पवनाहतवेगाभिरूर्मिभिर्विमलेऽम्भसि। पङ्कजानि विराजन्ते ताड्यमानानि लक्ष्मण।।4.1.65।।
explanation: 'O Lakshmana look at the lotuses in clear water dashing against one another due to waves caused by the force of the wind.

content: पद्मपत्रविशालाक्षीं सततं पङ्कजप्रियाम्। अपश्यतो मे वैदेहीं जीवितं नाभिरोचते।।4.1.66।।
explanation: 'Unable to see my beloved with eyes large like totus petals and an ardent lover of lotuses, I have no desire to live.

content: अहो कामस्य वामत्वं यो गतामपि दुर्लभाम्। स्मारयिष्यति कल्याणीं कल्याणतरवादिनीम्।।4.1.67।।
explanation: 'Oh how adversly disposed is the god of love He makes me remember that auspicious lady with a pleasing voice when she is lost and difficult to reach.

content: शक्यो धारयितुं कामो भवेदभ्यागतो मया। यदि भूयो वसन्तो मां न हन्यात्पुष्पितद्रुमः।।4.1.68।।
explanation: 'If the spring that has set in, with the trees in bloom does not kill me, I have once again to endure the agony of love.

content: यानि स्म रमणीयानि तया सह भवन्ति मे। तान्येवारमणीयानि जायन्ते मे तया विना।।4.1.69।।
explanation: 'Whatever was endearing to me earlier in the company of Sita, has turned out to be disenchanting without her.

content: पद्मकोशपलाशानि द्रष्टुं दृष्टिर्हि मन्यते। सीताया नेत्रकोशाभ्यां सदृशानीति लक्ष्मण।।4.1.70।।
explanation: 'Seeing the delicate petals around the lotus buds that look like beautiful eyelids of Sita, my eyes crave for them O Lakshmana

content: पद्मकेसरसंसृष्टो वृक्षान्तरविनिस्सृतः। निश्श्वास इव सीताया वाति वायुर्मनोहरः।।4.1.71।।
explanation: 'The bleeze that blows through the trees carrying the fragrance of the filaments of lotuses feels pleasant like Sita's breath.

content: सौमित्रे पश्य पम्पाया दक्षिणे गिरिसानुनि। पुष्पितां कर्णिकारस्य यष्टिं परमशोभनाम्।।4.1.72।।
explanation: 'Look at the very spectacular karnikara tree with its blossmed branches on the mountain slope towards the southern side of Pampa, O Saumitri

content: अधिकं शैलराजोऽयं धातुभिः सुविभूषितः। विचित्रं सृजते रेणुं वायुवेगविघट्टितम्।।4.1.73।।
explanation: 'This king of mountains is rich with plenty of minerals and, therefore, generates multicoloured dust particles splattered by the speed of the wind.

content: गिरिप्रस्थास्तु सौमित्रे सर्वतस्सम्प्रपुष्पितैः। निष्पत्रैस्सर्वतो रम्यैः प्रदीप्ता इव किंशुकैः।।4.1.74।।
explanation: 'O Saumitri With leafless kimsuka trees in full bloom all over the mountain ranges they appear beautiful like blazing mountains.

content: पम्पातीररुहाश्चेमे संसक्ता मधुगन्धिनः। मालतीमल्लिकाषण्डाः करवीराश्च पुष्पिताः।।4.1.75।।
explanation: 'Very closely grown on the banks of Pampa, stand malati, mallika and karavira trees with their clusters of fragrant blossoms.

content: केतक्यस्सिन्दुवाराश्च वासन्त्यश्च सुपुष्पिताः। माधव्यो गन्धपूर्णाश्च कुन्दगुल्माश्च सर्वशः।।4.1.76।।
explanation: 'Fully blossmed ketaka, sinduvara, madhavi and kunda bushes in spring scatter their fragrance everywhere.

content: चिरिबिल्वा मधूकाश्च वञ्जुला वकुलास्तथा।चम्पकास्तिलकाश्चैव नागवृक्षास्सुपुष्पिताः।।4.1.77।।नीपाश्च वरणाश्चैव खर्जूराश्च सुपुष्पिता।
explanation: 'Chiribilva, madhuka, vanjula, bakula, champaka, tilaka and naga varana and kharjura trees are in full bloom.

content: पद्मकाश्चैव शोभन्ते नीलाशोकाश्च पुष्पिताः। लोध्राश्च गिरिपृष्ठेषु सिंहकेसरपिञ्जराः।।4.1.78।।
explanation: 'Lotuses and blue asokas are also in bloom. Lodhra trees on the mountainslopes look golden like the lion's mane.

content: अङ्कोलाश्च कुरण्टाश्च चूर्णकाः पारिभद्रकाः। चूताः पाटलयश्चैव कोविदाराश्च पुष्पिताः।।4.1.79।।मुचुकुन्दार्जुनाश्चैव दृश्यन्ते गिरिसानुषु। केतकोद्दालकाश्चैव शिरीषाः शिंशुपा धवाः।।4.1.80।।
explanation: 'There are trees like ankola, kuranta, churnaka, paribhadraka, mango, patali, kovidara, muchukunda, arjuna, ketaka, uddalaka, shirisha, shimshupa and shava, all in full bloom on the mountain peaks.

content: शाल्मल्यः किंशुकाश्चैव रक्ताः कुरवकास्तथा।।4.1.81।।त्रिनिशा नक्तमालाश्च चन्दनास्स्यन्दनास्तथा।
पुष्पितान्पुष्पिताग्राभिर्लताभिः परिवेष्टितान्। द्रुमान्पश्येह सौमित्रे पम्पाया रुचिरान्बहून्।।4.1.8283।।
explanation: 'O Saumitri look at the beauty of these numerous flowering trees on the banks of Pampa, entwining creepers with blooming tops.

content: वातविक्षिप्तविटपान्यथाऽसन्नान्द्रुमानिमान्। लतास्समनुवर्तन्ते मत्ता इव वरस्त्रियः।।4.1.84।।
explanation: 'While the branches of trees swayed by the wind draw close, the creepers follow the trees like lovely women in a drunken state.

content: पादपात्पादपं गच्छन् शैलाच्छैलं वनाद्वनम्। वाति नैकरसास्वादस्सम्मोदित इवानिलः।।4.1.85।।
explanation: 'The wind blows from tree to tree, mountain to mountain, and forest to forest as though content to enjoy all the fragrance.

content: केचित्पर्याप्तकुसुमाः पादपा मधुगन्धिनः। केचिन्मुकुलसंवीताः श्यामवर्णा इवाबभुः।।4.1.86।।
explanation: 'Some trees stood fragrant with profuse flowers and some with buds shining blue.

content: इदं मृष्टमिदं स्वादु प्रफुल्लमिदमित्यपि। रागयुक्तो मधुकरः कुसुमेष्वेव लीयते।।4.1.87।।
explanation: 'Fascinated by the flowers, the honeybees cling to one or the other, humming, 'this is soft, this is sweet, and this is fullyblossomed.'

content: निलीय पुनरुत्पत्य सहसाऽन्यत्र गच्छति। मधुलुब्धो मधुकरः पम्पातीरद्रुमेष्वसौ।।4.1.88।।
explanation: 'The bees greedy for honey move among the trees on the banks of Pampa. Resting for a while, at one place they fly soon to another.

content: इयं कुसुमसङ्घातैरुपस्तीर्णा सुखाकृता। स्वयं निपतितैर्भूमिश्शयनप्रस्तरैरिव।।4.1.89।।
explanation: 'With countless flowers fallen on their own from trees and scattered like a bed of flowers on stone the ground is rendered comfortable enough to relax on.

content: विविधा विविधैः पुष्पैस्तैरेव नगसानुषु। विकीर्णै पीतरक्ताहि सौमित्रे प्रस्तराः कृताः।।4.1.90।।
explanation: 'O Saumitri varieties of colourful flowers, some red and some yellow, are spread out on the mountain slopes.

content: हिमान्ते पश्य सौमित्रे वृक्षाणां पुष्पसम्भवम्। पुष्पमासे हि तरवस्सङ्घर्षादिव पुष्पिताः।।4.1.91।।
explanation: 'Winter has ended and the season of flowers has set in, O Saumitri The trees are full of flowers as if competing with one another.

content: आह्वयन्त इवान्योन्यं नगाष्षट्पदनादिताः। कुसुमोत्तंसविटपाश्शोभन्ते बहु लक्ष्मण।।4.1.92।।
explanation: 'The trees, crowned with flowers filled with humming bees, look splendid. It appears they are calling one another, O Lakshmana

content: एष कारण्डवः पक्षी विगाह्य सलिलं शुभम्। रमते कान्तया सार्धं काममुद्दीपयन्मम।।4.1.93।।
explanation: 'This duck, entering into auspicious water, sports with its beloved and incites my love.

content: मन्दाकिन्यास्तु यदिदं रूपमेवं मनोहरम्। स्थाने जगति विख्याता गुणास्तस्या मनोरमाः।।4.1.94।।
explanation: 'Only Ganga, like Pampa, has such captivating charm. Its beauty and virtues are famous in the world.

content: यदि दृश्येत सा साध्वी यदि चेह वसेमहि। स्पृहयेयं न शक्राय नायोध्यायै रघूत्तम।।4.1.95।।
explanation: 'O Lakshmna, the best of the Raghu race, if only that chaste Sita appears, we will stay here. I will not wish for the position of Indra or for Ayodhya.

content: नह्येवं रमणीयेषु शाद्वलेषु तया सह। रमतो मे भवेच्चिन्ता न स्पृहाऽन्येषु वा भवेत्।।4.1.96।।
explanation: 'If I can sport with Sita in this beautiful green grassy land, I will not have any worry, I would not desire for any other pleasure.

content: अमी हि विविधैः पुष्पैस्तरवो रुचिरच्छदाः। काननेऽऽस्मिन्विना कान्तां चिन्तामुत्पादयन्ति मे।।4.1.97।।
explanation: 'These trees with their beautiful leaves and varieties of flowers bring me agony as I live in this forest separated from my beloved.

content: पश्य शीतजलां चेमां सौमित्रे पुष्करायुताम्। चक्रवाकानुचरितां कारण्डव निषेविताम्।।4.1.98।।
explanation: 'O Saumitri look at this lake of cool water filled with, lotuses, chakravakas flying about and ducks floating.

content: प्लवैः क्रौञ्चैश्च सम्पूर्णां महामृगनिषेविताम्। अधिकं शोभते पम्पा विकूजद्भिःर्विहङ्गमैः।।4.1.99।।दीपयन्तीव मे कामं विविधा मुदिता द्विजाः। श्यामां चन्द्रमुखीं स्मृत्वा प्रियां पद्मनिभेक्षणाम्।।4.1.100।।
explanation: Pampa, filled with swimming, kraunchas and frequented by big animals looks splendid. The joyous warbling of a variety of birds is highly exciting. They kindle my passion for my young, Moonfaced, lotus eyed beloved.

content: पश्य सानुषु चित्रेषु मृगीभिस्सहितान्मृगान्। मां पुनर्मृगशाबाक्ष्या वैदेह्या विरहीकृतम्।।4.1.101।।व्यथयन्तीव मे चित्तं सञ्चरन्तस्ततस्ततः।
explanation: Look at the (male) deer happily roaming here and there together with the female deer on the colourful mountain slopes. Separated from the fawneyed Vaidehi, this sight fills my heart with agony.

content: अस्मिन्सानुनि रम्ये हि मत्तद्विजगणायुते। पश्येयं यदि तां कान्तां ततस्स्वस्ति भवेन्मम।।4.1.102।।
explanation: 'If I find my dear beloved here on these mountain slopes full of passionate birds how happy will I not feel

content: जीवेयं खलु सौमित्रे मया सह सुमध्यमा। सेवते यदि वैदेही पम्पायाः पवनं सुखम्।।4.1.103।।
explanation: 'O Saumitri I can be alive and happy if Sita of slender waist enjoys here with me the sweet breeze of Pampa.

content: पद्मसौगन्धिकवहं शिवं शोकविनाशनम्। धन्या लक्ष्मण सेवन्ते पम्पोपवनमारुतम्।।4.1.104।।
explanation: 'O Lakshmana blessed are those who enjoy the breeze filled with fragrance of lotuses of the surrounding forests of Pampa. The gentle and auspicious breeze indeed takes away the sorrow of the mind.

content: श्यामा पद्मपलाशाक्षी प्रिया विरहिता मया। कथं धारयति प्राणान्विवशा जनकात्मजा।।4.1.105।।
explanation: 'How can Janaka's daughter with eyes like lotus petals, so young and loving, sustain her life? Away from me, she must be feeling quite dejected.

content: किन्नु वक्ष्यामि राजानं धर्मज्ञं सत्यवादिनम्। सीताया जनकं पृष्टः कुशलं जनसंसदि।।4.1.106।।
explanation: 'If righteous and truthful Janaka enquires about Sita's wellbeing in the assembly of people, what am I to speak ?

content: या मामनुगता मन्दं पित्रा प्रव्राजितं वनम्। सीता सत्पथमास्थाय क्व नु सा वर्तते प्रिया।।4.1.107।।
तया विहीनः कृपणः कथं लक्ष्मण धारये। या मामनुगता राज्याद्भ्रष्टं विगतचेतसम्।।4.1.108।।
explanation: 'She followed me, O Lakshmana  as I was deposed from the kingdom and distraught. Now helpless, how can I live without her?

content: तच्चार्वञ्चितपद्माक्षं सुगन्धि शुभमव्रणम्। अपश्यतो मुखं तस्यास्सीदतीव मनो मम।।4.1.109।।
explanation: 'Unable to see her beautiful, face with auspicious eyes like fragrant lotuses, I feel (so) depressed.

content: स्मितहास्यान्तरयुतं गुणवन्मधुरं हितम्। वैदेह्या वाक्यमतुलं कदा श्रोष्यामि लक्ष्मण।।4.1.110।।
explanation: 'When can I listen to Sita's sweet, wholesome and virtuous, incomparable words interlaced with her gentle smile, O Lakshmana?

content: प्राप्य दुखं वने श्यामा मां मन्मथविकर्शितम्। नष्टदुःखेव हृष्टेव साध्वी साध्वभ्यभाषत।।4.1.111।।
explanation: My young and faithful beloved used to put up a brave face and speak to me in all propriety to cheer me up in the midst of suffering in the forest whenever I felt tormented by passion.

content: किं नु वक्ष्यामि कौसल्यामयोध्यायां नृपात्मज। क्व सा स्नुषेति पृच्छन्तीं कथं चापि तु मनस्विनीम्।।4.1.112।।
explanation: 'O Prince, what can I tell the highminded Kausalya at Ayodhya when she asks the whereabouts of her daughterinlaw'?

content: गच्छ लक्ष्मण पश्य त्वं भरतं भ्रातृवत्सलम्। न ह्यहं जीवितु शक्तस्तामृते जनकात्मजाम्।।4.1.113।।
explanation: 'You may go to Ayodhya, O Lakshmana, to see our loving brother, Bharata. It is not possible for me to survive without the daughter of Janaka'.

content: इति रामं महात्मानं विलपन्तमनाथवत्। उवाच लक्ष्मणो भ्राता वचनं युक्तमव्ययम्।।4.1.114।।
explanation: Thus spoke Lakshmana these befitting, unforgettable words to his hissouled brother, Rama wailing like an orphan:

content: संस्तम्भ राम भद्रं ते मा शुचः पुरुषोत्तम। नेदृशानां मतिर्मन्दा भवत्यकलुषात्मनाम्।।4.1.115।।
explanation: 'O Rama, the foremost of men, control yourself. Be blessed. People who are pure at heart do not feel depressed at heart.

content: स्मृत्वा वियोगजं दुःखं त्यज स्नेहं प्रिये जने। अतिस्नेहपरिष्वङ्गाद्वर्तिरार्द्रापि दह्यते।।4.1.116।।
explanation: 'Remembrance of loved ones causes sorrow. Even a wet cotton wick gets burnt by embracing excessive oil. Hence abandon grief.

content: यदि गच्छति पातालं ततोऽभ्यधिकमेव वा। सर्वथा रावणस्तावन्न भविष्यति राघव।।4.1.117।।
explanation: 'Even if Ravana escapes into the nether world or into a world still lower, he cannot save himself by any means, O Rama

content: प्रवृत्तिर्लभ्यतां तावत्तस्य पापस्य रक्षसः। ततो हास्यति वा सीतां निधनं वा गमिष्यति।।4.1.118।।
explanation: 'Once the whereabouts of that sinful demon are known he will either deliver Sita or die.

content: यदि यातिदितेर्गर्भं रावणस्सह सीतया। तत्राप्येनं हनिष्यामि न चेद्दास्यति मैथिलीम्।।4.1.119।।
explanation: 'Even if Ravana enters into the womb of Diti (mother of demons) along with Sita, I will slay him there if he does not return the daughter of Mithila.

content: स्वास्थ्यं भद्रं भजस्वार्य त्यज्यतां कृपणा मतिः। अर्थो हि नष्टकार्यार्थैर्नायत्नेनाधिगम्यते।।4.1.120।।
explanation: 'O noble prince be blessed. maintain composure. Without making any effort it is not possible to achieve the objective and recoup loss.

content: उत्साहो बलवानार्य नास्त्युत्साहात्परं बलम्। सोत्साहस्यास्ति लोकेऽस्मिन् न किञ्चिदपि दुर्लभम्।।4.1.121।।
explanation: 'O revered Sire, enterprise is supreme strength. Nothing is difficult in this world for one who is up and doing.

content: उत्साहवन्तः पुरुषा नावसीदन्ति कर्मसु। उत्साहमात्रमाश्रित्य सीतां प्रतिलभेमहि।।4.1.122।।
explanation: 'Enterprising men will never be disappointed in their mission. It is possible to get Sita through effort alone.

content: त्यज्यतां कामवृत्तत्वं शोकं सन्न्यस्य पृष्ठतः। महात्मानं कृतात्मानमात्मानं नावबुध्यसे।।4.1.123।।
explanation: 'Bardon grief. Give up emotion. You are a great soul. You are not aware of your great accomplishments. (The temporary sorrow has relegated Rama's nobility to the background. Lakshmana is trying to restore the same)'.

content: एवं सम्बोधितस्तत्र शोकोपहतचेतनः। त्यज्य शोकञ्च मोहञ्च ततो धैर्यमुपागमत्।।4.1.124।।
explanation: Thus persuaded by Lakshmana, Rama who was hitherto besieged by grief and delusion, could set them aside and regain patience.

content: सोऽभ्यतिक्रामदव्यग्रस्तामचिन्त्यपराक्रमः। रामः पम्पां सुरुचिरां रम्यपारिप्लवद्रुमाम्।।4.1.125।।
explanation: No more disturbed by delusion, Rama of unimaginable valour, crossed the very brilliant Pampa with beautiful plants floating on its surface.

content: निरीक्षमाणस्सहसा महात्मा सर्वं वनं निर्झरकन्दराश्च। उद्विग्नचेतास्सह लक्ष्मणेन विचार्य दुःखोपहतः प्रतस्थे।।4.1.126।।
explanation: The great Rama was overcome with grief while scanning the entire forest with its streams and caves. Engrossed in her thoughts, dejected at heart and inflicted with pain, he set both, accompanied by Lakshmana.

content: तं मत्तमातङ्गविलासगामी गच्छन्तमव्यग्रमना महात्मा। स लक्ष्मणो राघवमप्रमत्तो ररक्ष धर्मेण बलेन चैव।।4.1.127।।
explanation: The great soul, Lakshmana, striding like a mighty elephant, with a steady mind, followed Rama dutifully, protecting him with his strength.

content: तावृष्यमूकस्य समीपचारी चरन्ददर्शाद्भुतदर्शनीयौ। शाखामृगाणामधिपस्तरस्वी वितत्रसे नैव चिचेष्ट किञ्चित्।।4.1.128।।
explanation: The swiftfooted, mighty king of monkeys saw those two men of wonderful appearance as they were wandering at Rishyamuka. He neither got scared nor showed signs of nervousness.

content: स तौ महात्मा गजमन्दगामी शाखामृगस्तत्र चरञ्चरन्तौ। दृष्ट्वा विषादं परमं जगाम चिन्तापरीतो भयभारमग्नः।।4.1.129।।
explanation: The great soul, Sugriva, walking slowly like an elephant saw both of them and became despondent, worried and immersed in fear.

content: तमाश्रमं पुण्यसुखं शरण्यं सदैव शाखामृगसेवितान्तम्। त्रस्ताश्च दृष्ट्वा हरयोऽभिजग्मुर्महौजसौ राघवलक्ष्मणौ तौ।।4.1.130।।
explanation: Having seen the mighty Rama and Lakshmana, all other monkeys got frightened and ran into a sacred and safe hermitage.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे प्रथमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the first sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Sugriva becomes perturbed seeing Rama and Lakshmana -- gives directions to Hanuman to find out their details]                                            तौ तु दृष्ट्वा महात्मानौ भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।वरायुधधरौ वीरौ सुग्रीवश्शङ्कितोऽभवत्4.2.1।।
explanation: On seeing the two great souls, heroic Rama and Lakshmana wielding the best of weapons, Sugriva was alarmed.

content: उद्विग्नहृदयस्सर्वा दिशस्समवलोकयन्।न व्यतिष्ठत कस्मिंश्चिद्देशे वानरपुङ्गवः। 4.2.2।।
explanation: Agitated at heart, the best of vanaras started in all directions and could not settle down at one spot.

content: नैव चक्रे मनः स्थातुं वीक्षमाणो महाबलौ।कपेः परमभीतस्य चित्तं व्यवससाद ह4.2.3।।
explanation: Beholding the two strong heroes, the monkey (Sugriva) was very much frightened. His heart sank.

content: चिन्तयित्वा स धर्मात्मा विमृश्य गुरुलाघवम्।सुग्रीवः परमोद्विग्नस्सर्वैरनुचरैस्सह4.2.4।।
explanation: Righteous Sugriva, became highly agitated, deliberated with all his followers on the pros and cons of the situation.

content: ततस्स सचिवेभ्यस्तु सुग्रीवः प्लवगाधिपः।शशंस परमोद्विग्नः पश्यंस्तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ4.2.5।।
explanation: Sugriva, lord of monkeys, extremely agitated at the sight of both Rama and Lakshmana, spoke to his minister:

content: एतौ वनमिदं दुर्गं वालिप्रणिहितौ ध्रुवम्।छद्मना चीरवसनौ प्रचरन्ताविहागतौ4.2.6।।
ततस्सुग्रीवसचिवा दृष्ट्वा परमधन्विनौ।जग्मुर्गिरितटात्तस्मादन्यच्छिखरमुत्तमम्4.2.7।।
explanation: On seeing these supreme bowmen, Sugriva's counsellers left for the peak of another mountain.

content: ते क्षिप्रमधिगम्याथ यूथपा यूथपर्षभम्। हरयो वानरश्रेष्ठं परिवार्योपतस्थिरे4.2.8।।
explanation: The leaders of the monkey troops  reached Sugriva, the lord of monkeys, in no time  and stood surrounding him.

content: एकमेकायनगताः प्लवमाना गिरेर्गिरिम्।प्रकम्पयन्तो वेगेन गिरीणां शिखराण्यपि4.2.9।।
explanation: Jumping  from one mountain to another swiftly and shaking the mountain tops, the monkeys reached one spot.

content: ततश्शाखामृगास्सर्वे प्लवमाना महाबलाः।बभञ्जुश्च नगांस्तत्र पुष्पितान्दुर्गसंश्रितान्4.2.10।।
explanation: Then the mighty monkeys jumping on the trees in full bloom shook them.

content: आप्लवन्तो हरिवरास्सर्वतस्तं महागिरिम्।मृगमार्जारशार्दूलांस्त्रासयन्तो ययुस्तदा4.2.11।।
explanation: The great monkeys went on leaping all over the great (Rishyamuka) mountain,   scaring the deer, wildcats and tigers.

content: ततस्सुग्रीवसचिवाः पर्वतेन्द्रं समाश्रिताः।सङ्गम्य कपिमुख्येन सर्वे प्राञ्जलय स्थिताः।।4.2.12।।
explanation: Thereafter, all the ministers of Sugriva assembled together on the king of mountains and stood (in front of Sugriva), with folded hands.

content: ततस्तं भयसंविग्नं वालिकिल्बिषशङ्कितम्।उवाच हनुमान्वाक्यं सुग्रीवं वाक्यकोविदः4.2.13।।
explanation: Suspecting that Vali might have sent them (Rama and Lakshmana), Hanuman, skilful in communication, said to Sugriva who was trembling in fear:

content: सम्भ्रमस्त्यज्यतामेष सर्वैर्वालिकृते महान्।मलयोऽयं गिरिवरो भयं नेहास्ति वालिनः4.2.14।।
explanation: 'This is a great mountain range of Malaya and there is no fear for Vali here. Give up this fear.

content: यस्मादुद्विग्नचेतास्त्वं प्रद्रुतो हरिपुङ्गव।तं क्रूरदर्शनं क्रूरं नेह पश्यामि वालिनम्4.2.15।।
explanation: 'O chief of monkeys I do not see here any sign of the cruel Vali, of whom you are afraid.

content: यस्मात्तव भयं सौम्य पूर्वजात्पापकर्मणः।स नेह वाली दुष्टात्मा न ते पश्याम्यहं भयम्4.2.16।।
explanation: 'O goodnatured Sugriva you are afraid of your elder brother Vali as he is evilminded and sinful. (But) I do not see any reason for you to be frightened as he is not found anywhere here.

content: अहो शाखामृगत्वं ते व्यक्तमेव प्लवङ्गम।लघुचित्ततयाऽत्मानं न स्थापयसि यो मतौ4.2.17।।
explanation: 'Oh monkey, whoever is lilylivered cannot be steady. It is evident that your very nature as a monkey makes you restless.

content: बुद्धिविज्ञानसम्पन्न इङ्गितैस्सर्वमाचर।न ह्यबुद्धिं गतो राजा सर्वभूतानि शास्ति हि4.2.18।।
सुग्रीवस्तु शुभं वाक्यं श्रुत्वा सर्वं हनूमतः।ततश्शुभतरं वाक्यं हनूमन्तमुवाच ह4.2.19।।
explanation: Having heard the wise words of Hanuman, Sugriva addressed him with words more auspicious.

content: दीर्घबाहू विशालाक्षौ शरचापासिधारिणौ। कस्य न स्याद्भयं दृष्ट्वा ह्येतौ सुरसुतोपमौ4.2.20।।
explanation: 'Who would not be apprehensive of these two longarmed and largeeyed individuals     comparable to sons of gods wielding arrows, bows and swords.

content: वालिप्रणिहितावेतौ शङ्केऽहं पुरुषोत्तमौ।राजानो बहुमित्राश्च विश्वासो नात्र हि क्षमः4.2.21।।
explanation: 'I support these two excellent men might have been sent by Vali. Kings have many friends and so it may not be appropriate to trust any king.

content: अरयश्च मनुष्येण विज्ञेयाश्छद्मचारिणः।विश्वस्तानामविश्वस्तारन्ध्रेषु प्रहरन्ति हि4.2.22।।
explanation: 'One has to identify these men roaming in disguise. These are not trustworthy and could even be our enemies, making us believe them so as to attack us when we are not vigilant.

content: कृत्येषु वाली मेधावी राजानो बहुदर्शिनः।भवन्ति परहन्तारस्ते ज्ञेयाः प्राकृतैर्नरैः4.2.23।।
explanation: 'Vali is wise in his actions. Kings employ many strategies to annihilate their enemies. Our gullible individuals should be able to detect them.

content: तौ त्वया प्राकृतेनैव गत्वा ज्ञेयौ प्लवङ्गम।इङ्गितानां प्रकारैश्च रूपव्याभाषणेन च4.2.24।।
explanation: 'O Hanuman assume an ordinary form and approach them. Try to read them through their gestures, traits, forms and conversations.

content: लक्षयस्व तयोर्भावं प्रहृष्टमनसौ यदि।विश्वासयन्प्रशंसाभिरिङ्गितैश्च पुनः पुनः4.2.25।।ममैवाभिमुखं स्थित्वा पृच्छ त्वं हरिपुङ्गव ।प्रयोजनं प्रवेशस्य वनस्यास्य धनुर्धरौ4.2.26।।
explanation: 'O best of monkeys ascertain their purpose by praising them and studying their honest intentions. Gain the confidence of the wielders of bows and if you find them agreeable, enquire the purpose of their entering this forest.

content: शुद्धात्मानौ यदि त्वेतौ जानीहि त्वं प्लवङ्गम।व्याभाषितैर्वा विज्ञेया स्याद्दुष्टाऽदुष्टता तयोः4.2.27।।
explanation: 'O best of monkeys find out whether they are noble in their intentions or evil in their design through your conversation with them.'

content: इत्येवं कपिराजेन सन्दिष्टो मारुतात्मजः।चकार गमने बुद्धिं यत्र तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ4.2.28।।
explanation: Instructed thus by the king of the monkeys, Hanuman, son of the Windgod, decided to meet both Rama and Lakshmana.

content: तथेति सम्पूज्य वचस्तु तस्यतत्कपेस्सुभीमस्य दुरासदस्य च।महानुभावो हनुमान्ययौ तदास यत्र रामोऽतिबलश्च लक्ष्मणः4.2.29।।
explanation: Hanuman, the venerable, powerful and not easily conquerable monkey, honoured the words of the great Lord of the monkeys, offered salutations and said 'So be it'. And then proceeded towards the mighty Rama and Lakshmana.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे द्वितीयस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the second sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by the sage Valmiki.

content: [Hanuman goes in the guise of a pious mendicant to meet Rama and Lakshmana -- Rama wonders at Hanuman's knowledge -- Hanuman reveals his identity and the purpose of his meeting -- Rama agrees to see Sugriva]वचो विज्ञाय हनुमान् सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः।पर्वतादृश्यमूकात्तु पुप्लुवे यत्र राघवौ।।4.3.1।।
explanation: Listening to great Sugriva, Hanuman leaped from mount Rishyamuka on to the location of the Raghavas.

content: कपिरूपं परित्यज्य हनुमान्मारुतात्मजः।भिक्षुरूपं ततो भेजे शठबुद्धितया कपिः4.3.2।।
explanation: Hanuman, son of the Windgod, with an ingenious mind assumed the guise of a mendicant.

content: ततस्स हनुमान्वाचा श्लक्ष्णया सुमनोज्ञया।विनीतवदुपागम्य राघवौ प्रणिपत्य च।।4.3.3।।आबभाषे तदा वीरौ यथावत्प्रशशंस च।
explanation: Approaching the Raghavas in all humility, valiant Hanuman offered them reverential salutations and addressed them in gentle and pleasing words.

content: सम्पूज्य विधिवद्वीरौ हनुमान्मारुतात्मजः।उवाच कामतो वाक्यं मृदु सत्यपराक्रमौ4.3.4।।
explanation: The valiant son of the Windgod, Hanuman offered those heroes whose power came from their sense of truth due respect and spoke to them in all gentleness:

content: राजर्षिदेवप्रतिमौ तापसौ संशितव्रतौ।देशं कथमिमं प्राप्तौ भवन्तौ वरवर्णिनौ4.3.5।।त्रासयन्तौ मृगगणानन्यांश्च वनचारिणः4.3.6।।
explanation: 'You both fair in complexion, resemble royal sages or gods. You appear like ascetics and pursue vows in austerity. How come, you are present here, as if to frighten the animals and other creatures roaming this forest?

content: पम्पातीररुहान्वृक्षान् वीक्षमाणौ समन्ततः।इमां नदीं शुभजलां शोभयन्तौ तपस्विनौ4.3.7।।धैर्यवन्तौ सुवर्णाभौ कौ युवां चीरवाससौ।निःश्वसन्तौ वरभुजौ पीडयन्ताविमाः प्रजा:4.3.8।।
explanation: 'Gazing at the trees on the bank of Pampa, you both appear in brilliant complexion as if to enhance the beauty of the auspicious river water. Though young, courageous and with handsome shoulders, you seem to sigh in exhaustion. And though you look like ascetics robed in bark,  you seem to terrify these creatures.

content: सिंहविप्रेक्षितौ वीरौ महाबलविक्रमौ।शक्रचापनिभे चापे गृहीत्वा शत्रुसूदनौ4.3.9।।श्रीमन्तौ रूपसम्पन्नौ वृषभश्रेष्ठविक्रमौ।हस्तिहस्तोपमभुजौ द्युतिमन्तौ नरर्षभौ4.3.10।।
explanation: 'Having the gaze  of a lion, both of you are heroic in your stance. As each of you hold a bow resembling the rainbow, you seem to be mighty warriors eager to annihilate the enemies. With the valour of superior bulls and your shoulders resembling elephant's trunks, you look magnificent, handsome and brilliant. (No doubt,) you are the best among the humans.

content: प्रभया पर्वतेन्द्रोऽयं युवयोरवभासितः।राज्यार्हावमरप्रख्यौ कथं देशमिहागतौ4.3.11।।
explanation: 'You are young and radiant like the gods. This king of mountains (Rishyamuka) dazzles with your brilliance. Although you deserve to be sovereigns, how is it that you are here (into the forest)?

content: पद्मपत्रेक्षणौ वीरौ जटामण्डलधारिणौ।अन्योन्यसदृशौ वीरौ देवलोकादिवागतौ4.3.12।।यदृच्छयेव सम्प्राप्तौ चन्द्रसूर्यौ वसुन्धराम्।विशालवक्षसौ वीरौ मानुषौ देवरूपिणौ4.3.13।।सिंहस्कन्धौ महोत्साहौ समदाविव गोवृषौ।
explanation: 'Both of you appear alike, with eyes like lotus petals and locks of matted hair. You look like heroes descending from the world of the gods. You look like the Sun and the Moon dropped incidentally on this earth. With shoulders like those of a lion and the majesty of energetic bulls, you broadchested warriors appear like divine beings, though in fact humans.

content: आयताश्च सुवृत्ताश्च बाहवः परिघोपमाः।सर्वभूषणभूषार्हाः किमर्थं न विभूषिताः4.3.14।।
explanation: 'Your long arms and spherelike shoulders appear as strong as iron clubs. Although they deserve to be decked with ornaments, how is it they are unadorned?

content: उभौ योग्यावहं मन्ये रक्षितुं पृथिवीमिमाम्।ससागरवनां कृत्स्नां विन्ध्यमेरुविभूषिताम्4.3.15।।
explanation: 'To me, you both deserve to rule the entire earth encompassed by seas and forests and adorned with mountains like Vindhya and Meru.

content: इमे च धनुषी चित्रे श्लष्णे चित्रानुलेपने।प्रकाशेते यथेन्द्रस्य वज्रे हेमविभूषिते4.3.16।।
explanation: 'Smeared with wonderful unguents, (your) bows look  very attractive. And they glow very much like Indra's golden thunderbolt.

content: सम्पूर्णा निशितैर्बाणै स्तूणाश्च शुभदर्शनाः4.3.17।।जीवितान्तकरैर्घोरै श्श्वसद्भिरिव पन्नगैः।।
explanation: '(Your) quivers also appear beautiful, for they are  fully  filled with sharp and deadly arrows which look like the hissing of dreadful snakes

content: महाप्रमाणौ विस्तीर्णौ तप्तहाटकभूषितौ4.3.18।।खडगावेतौ विराजेते निर्मुक्ताविवपन्नगौ।।
explanation: '(Your) long and broad swords appear very huge in size. Being encrusted with pure gold, they  glitter brilliant like snakes in hyberation.

content: एवं मां परिभाषन्तं कस्माद्वै नाभिभाषथः4.3.19।।सुग्रीवो नाम धर्मात्मा कश्चिद्वानरयूथपः।वीरो विनिकृतो भ्रात्रा जगद्भ्रमति दुःखितः4.3.20।।
explanation: 'Why are you silent  while I am talking? (I am here to apprise ) about a great and righteous warrior Sugriva, the chief of the troop of monkeys, sadly wandering all over the land here, banished by his brother

content:
प्राप्तोऽहं प्रेषितस्तेन सुग्रीवेण महात्मना।

राज्ञा वानरमुख्यानां हनुमान्नाम वानरः4.3.21।।
explanation: 'I am a monkey called Hanuman. I am here sent by great king Sugriva, the best of monkeys.

content: युवाभ्यां सह धर्मात्मा सुग्रीवस्सख्यमिच्छति।तस्य मां सचिवं वित्तं वानरं पवनात्मजम्4.3.22।।भिक्षुरूपप्रतिच्छन्नं सुग्रीवप्रियकाम्यया।ऋष्यमूकादिह प्राप्तं कामगं कामरूपिणम्4.3.23।।
explanation: 'The righteous Sugriva wishes to make friendship with both of you. For his wellbeing I came here disguised as a mendicant from  Rishyamuka mountain. I am a monkey, son of the Windgod and minister to Sugriva. I can assume any form at my free will and go anywhere I like'.

content: एवमुक्त्वा तु हनुमांस्तौ वीरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।वाक्यज्ञौ वाक्यकुशलः पुनर्नोवाच किञ्चन4.3.24।।
explanation: The eloquent Hanuman, having spoken thus to both Rama and Lakshmana, good at speaking, said no more.

content: एतच्छ्रुत्वा वचन्तस्य रामो लक्ष्मणमब्रवीत्।प्रहृष्टवदनश्श्रीमान्भ्रातरं पार्श्वतः स्थितम्4.3.25।।
explanation: Having heard him, the Illustrious Rama cheerfully said to brother Lakshmana standing nearby:

content: सचिवोऽयं कपीन्द्रस्य सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः।तमेव काङ्क्षमाणस्य ममान्तिकमुपागतः4.3.26।।
explanation: 'Here is minister to Sugriva, the great chief of monkeys whom I wish to see.

content: तमभ्यभाष सौमित्रे सुग्रीवसचिवं कपिम्।वाक्यज्ञं मधुरैर्वाक्यैस्स्नेहयुक्तमरिन्दम।।4.3.27।।
explanation: 'O Saumitri, conqueror of enemies this monkey, Sugriva's minister, is skilled in friendly communication. Reply to him in words gentle and sweet.

content: नानृग्वेदविनीतस्य नायजुर्वेद्धारिणः।नासामवेदविदुषश्शक्यमेवं विभाषितुम्4.3.28।।
explanation: 'Unless wellversed in Rigveda, Yajurveda and Samaveda, for sure, it is not possible for anyone to articulate so well.

content: नूनं व्याकरणं कृत्स्नमनेन बहुधा श्रुतम्।बहु व्याहरताऽनेन न किञ्चिदपशब्दितम्4.3.29।।
explanation: 'Surely, he seems to have studied well the whole of grammar, for there is not a single mispronunciation in his entire speech.

content:
न मुखे नेत्रयोर्वापि ललाटे च भ्रुवोस्तथा।

अन्येष्वपि च गात्रेषु दोषस्संविदितः क्वचित्4.3.30।।
explanation: No fault can be found in his face, eyes, forehead, between the eyebrows or any other part of his body (during his expression).

content:
अविस्तरमसन्दिग्धमविलम्बितमद्रुतम्।

उरस्थं कण्ठगं वाक्यं वर्तते मध्यमे स्वरे4.3.31।।
explanation: His sentences are not too elaborate, not ambiguous, not dragging, not fast, raised in the chest or throat, in a medium tone.

content: संस्कारक्रमसम्पन्नामद्रुतामविलम्बिताम्।उच्चारयति कल्याणीं वाचं हृदयहारिणीम्4.3.32।।
explanation: 'His words are auspicious. They are refined. Neither fast nor slow, his utterances captivate the heart.

content: अनया चित्रया वाचा त्रिस्थानव्यञ्जनस्थया।कस्य नाराध्यते चित्तमुद्यतासेररेरपि4.3.33।।
explanation: 'His colourful words flow from all the three sources: the bottom of his bosom, his throat and his head. Whose mind will not adore them even if one happens to be an enemy holding a sword?

content: एवं विधो यस्य दूतो न भवेत्पार्थिवस्य तु।सिद्ध्यन्ति हि कथं तस्य कार्याणां गतियोऽनघ4.3.34।।
explanation: 'O sinless one, how can a king, whoever he be, not accomplish his goal in the past with such an ambassador?

content:
एवं गुणगणैर्युक्ता यस्य स्युः कार्यसाधकाः।

तस्य सिध्यन्ति सर्वाऽर्था दूतवाक्यप्रचोदिताः4.3.35।।
explanation: Whoever has such great taskmasters of great qualities as their envoys, can have all their goals accomplished, driven by their diplomatic skills.

content: एवमुक्तस्तु सौमित्रिस्सुग्रीवसचिवं कपिम्।अभ्यभाषत वाक्यज्ञो वाक्यज्ञं पवनात्मजम्4.3.36।।
explanation: Thus instructed, Saumitri who was equally skilled in speach replied to Sugriva's minister, son of the Windgod

content: विदितौ नौ गुणा विद्वंत्सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः।तमेव चाऽवां मार्गावस्सुग्रीवं प्लवगेश्वरम्4.3.37।।
explanation: 'O learned Hanuman having heard about the virtues of  great Sugriva, lord of the monkeys, we eagerly look forward to meeting him

content: यथा ब्रवीषि हनुमान्सुग्रीववचनादिह।तत्तथा हि करिष्यावो वचनात्तव सत्तम4.3.38।।
explanation: 'O virtuous Hanuman we will do whatever you are saying, for it is the message of Sugriva.

content: तत्तस्य वाक्यं निपुणं निशम्यप्रहृष्टरूपः पवनात्मजः कपिः।मनस्समाधाय जयोपपत्तौसख्यं तदा कर्तुमियेष ताभ्याम्4.3.39।।
explanation: Pleased with Lakshmana's words spoken in a skilful manner, Hanuman, the monkey son of the Windgod, resolved to make friendship with them.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे तृतीयस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the third sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Lakshmana speaks to Hanuman the purpose of their arrival at Rishyamuka -- Hanuman takes Rama and Lakshmana on his shoulders to Sugriva]ततः प्रहृष्टौ हनुमान्कृत्यवानिति तद्वचः।श्रुत्वा मधुरसम्भाषं  सुग्रीवं मनसा गतः4.4.1।।
explanation: After listening to the sweet words of Lakshmana, Hanuman, having done what he had to do felt happy and thought of Sugriva.

content: भव्यो राज्यागमस्तस्य सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः। यदयं कृत्यवान्प्राप्तः कृत्यं चैतदुपागतम्4.4.2।।
explanation: The great Sugriva, thinks Hanuman, who had done his duty is likely to acquire his kingdom, because great Rama who would help in the work of Sugriva has also come.'

content: ततः परमसंहृष्टो हनुमान् प्लवगर्षभः।प्रत्युवाच ततो वाक्यं रामं वाक्यविशारदः4.4.3।।
explanation: Hanuman, the best of the monkeys, learned in conversation, felt extremely happy and enquired from Rama:

content: किमिर्थं त्वं वनं घोरं पम्पाकाननमण्डितम्।आगतस्सानुजो दुर्गं नानाव्याळमृगायुतम्4.4.4।।
explanation: 'Why have you come with your brother to this dreadful, inaccessible forest surrounding Pampa, full of different varieties of serpents and wild animals?'

content: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा लक्ष्मणो रामचोदितः।आचचक्षे महात्मानं रामं दशरथात्मजम्4.4.5।।
explanation: Having listened to Hanuman, and urged by Rama, Lakshmana told him about the great Rama, son of Dasaratha.

content: राजा दशरथो नाम द्युतिमान्धर्मवत्सलः।चातुर्वर्ण्यं स्वधर्मेण नित्यमेवाभ्यपालयत्4.4.6।।
न द्वेष्टा विद्यते तस्य न च स द्वेष्टि कञ्चन।स च सर्वेषु भूतेषु पितामह इवापरः4.4.7।।अग्निष्टोमादिभिर्यज्ञैरिष्टवानाप्तदक्षिणैः।
explanation: 'He never hated any one nor did any one ever hate him. To all his subjects, he was like another father, the Creator Brahma. And he was generous in giving gifts while performing yajnas (rituals with fire) like Agnistoma.

content: तस्यायं पूर्वजः पुत्रो रामो नाम जनैः श्रुतः।।4.4.8।।शरण्यस्सर्वभूतानां पितुर्निर्देशपारगः।
explanation: 'Here is his eldest son, popularly known as Rama. He is the protector of all beings and never failed his father's instructions.

content: वीरो दशरथस्यायं पुत्राणां गुणवत्तमः।।4.4.9।।राजलक्षणसम्पन्नस्सम्युक्तो राजसम्पदा।राज्याद्भ्रष्टो वने वस्तुं मया सार्धमिहागतः4.4.10।।
भार्यया च महातेजास्सीतयाऽनुगतो वशी।दिनक्षये महातेजाः प्रभयेव दिवाकरः4.4.11।।
explanation: 'This glorious Rama was followed by his wife, Sita, like the rays of the effulgent Sun follow him to the end of the day.

content: अहमस्यावरो भ्राता गुणैर्दास्यमुपागतः।कृतज्ञस्य बहुज्ञस्य लक्ष्मणो नाम नामतः4.4.12।।
explanation: 'I am his younger brother, called Lakshmana. I have accepted the service of this learned, virtuous and grateful man.

content: सुखार्हस्य महार्हस्य सर्वभूतहितात्मनः।ऐश्वर्येण च हीनस्य वनवासाश्रितस्य च4.4.13।।रक्षसाऽपहृता भार्या रहिते कामरूपिणा।तच्च न ज्ञायते रक्षः पत्नी येनास्य सा हृता4.4.14।।
explanation: 'This man who should have lived in comfort and in reverence, one who was worthy of all the wellwishers lost his wealth and was banished into the forest. He is now deprived of his wife kidnapped by an unknown demon who could assume any form at will.

content: दनुर्नाम दितेः पुत्रश्शापाद्राक्षसतां गतः।आख्यातस्तेन सुग्रीवस्समर्थो वानरर्षभः4.4.15।।
explanation: 'Diti's son called Danu who had been cursed to live the life of a demon had said that Sugriva, the best among monkeys, would be able to locate her.

content: स ज्ञास्यति महावीर्यस्तव भार्यापहारिणम्।एवमुक्त्वा दनुस्स्वर्गं भ्राजमानो गतस्सुखम्4.4.16।।
explanation: 'That Valiant Sugriva can spot the demon who has abducted your wife', said Danu and disappeared happily into heaven shining in brilliance.

content: एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातं यथा तथ्येन पृच्छतः।अहं चैव हि रामश्च सुग्रीवं शरणं गतौ4.4.17।।
explanation: 'I have given a factual account of everything, since you asked me. Now Rama and I have arrived seeking Sugriva's shelter.

content: एष दत्त्वा च वित्तानि प्राप्य चानुत्तमं यशः।लोकनाथः पुरा भूत्वा सुग्रीवं नाथमिच्छति4.4.18।।
explanation: 'Having earned supreme fame through his munificence in the past, this lord of the world now craves Sugriva's indulgence.

content: पिता यस्य पुरा ह्यासीच्छरण्यो धर्मवत्सलः।तस्य पुत्रश्शरण्यश्च सुग्रीवं शरणं गतः4.4.19।।
explanation: 'One whose father was once a protector of dharma, a refuge to all now seeks Sugriva's shelter.

content: सर्वलोकस्य धर्मात्मा शरण्यश्शरणं पुरा।गुरुर्मे राघवस्सोऽयं सुग्रीवं शरणं गतः4.4.20।।
explanation: 'This righteous Rama who used to lend in the past protection to the whole world and, indeed, a refuge to all, venerable sir, now seeks Sugriva's shelter.

content: यस्य प्रसादे सततं प्रसीदेयुरिमाः प्रजाः।स रामो वानरेन्द्रस्य प्रसादमभिकाङ्क्षते। 4.4.21।।
explanation: 'This Rama for whose grace the subjects were ever bobolden to him now seeks the favour of the Chief of monkeys.

content: येन सर्वगुणोपेताः पृथिव्यां सर्वपार्थिवाः।मानितास्सततं राज्ञा सदा दशरथेन वै4.4.22तस्यायं पूर्वजः पुत्रस्त्रिषु लोकेषु विश्रुतः।सुग्रीवं वानरेन्द्रं तु रामश्शरणमागतः4.4.23।।
explanation: 'Famous in all the three worlds, this Rama, who was the firshborn of Dasaratha, endowed with all virtues and ever respected by all the kings of this earth, now seeks shelter of Sugriva, Chief of monkeys.

content: शोकाभिभूते रामे तु शोकार्ते शरणं गते।कर्तुमर्हति सुग्रीवः प्रसादं हरियूधपः4.4.24।।
explanation: 'Sugriva, lord of monkeys, ought to help Rama who tormented by, and overwhelmed with, grief seeks his favour.'

content: एवं ब्रुवाणं सौमित्रिं करुणं साश्रुलोचनम्।हनुमान्प्रत्युवाचेदं वाक्यं वाक्यविशारदः4.4.25।।
explanation: To Saumitri who was speaking thus in a piteous tone, his eyes filled with tears the eloquent Hanuman replied:

content: ईदृशा बुद्धिसम्पन्ना जितक्रोधा जितेन्द्रियाः।द्रष्टव्या वानरेन्द्रेण दिष्ट्या दर्शनमागताः4.4.26।।
explanation: 'It is a matter of great fortune that you who have intelligence, control over your senses and conquered anger have come to see the lord of monkeys who needs instead, to approach you.

content: स हि राज्यात्परिभ्रष्टः कृतवैरश्च वालिना।हृतदारो वने त्यक्तो भ्रात्रा विनिकृतो भृशम्4.4.27।।
explanation: '(In fact) seriously offended by his brother Vali who treated him like his enemy and expelled him from the kingdom. He is now abandoned in the forest, his wife hijacked.

content: करिष्यति स साहाय्यं युवयोर्भास्करात्मजः।सुग्रीवस्सह चास्माभि स्सीतायाः परिमार्गणे4.4.28।।
explanation: 'Sugriva, son of the Sungod, along with us will extend all help to you, in your search for Sita.'

content: इत्येवमुक्त्वा हनुमान् श्लक्ष्णं मधुरया गिरा।बभाषे सोऽभिगच्छेम सुग्रीवमिति राघवम्4.4.29।।
explanation: Hanuman, having spoken with sweet, gentle words said to the Raghavas, 'We will now go to Sugriva'.

content: एवं ब्रुवाणं धर्मात्मा हनुमन्तं स लक्ष्मणः।प्रतिपूज्य यथान्यायमिदं प्रोवाच राघवम्4.4.30।।
explanation: Having offered reverential salutations to Hanuman as per tradition, righteous Lakshmana now spoke to Rama:

content: कपिः कथयते हृष्टो यथाऽयं मारुतात्मजः।कृत्यवांत्सोऽपि सम्प्राप्तः कृतकृत्योऽसि राघव4.4.31।।
explanation: 'O Raghava this monkey, son of the Windgod appears pleased as evident from his words. As he is a man of action, take your work as accomplished now.

content: प्रसन्नमुखवर्णश्च व्यक्तं हृष्टश्च भाषते।नानृतं वक्ष्यते वीरो हनुमान्मारुतात्मजः4.4.32।।
explanation: 'It is evident from his words  and from his cheerful face that Hanuman is pleased. (I know that) this heroic son of the Windgod will never tell a lie'.

content: ततस्स तु महाप्राज्ञो हनुमान्मारुतात्मजः।जगामादाय तौ वीरौ हरिराजाय राघवौ4.4.33।।
explanation: Hanuman, son of the Windgod, endowed with great wisdom carried both the Raghava warriors to the king of monkeys.

content: भिक्षुरूपं परित्यज्य वानरं रूपमास्थितः।पृष्ठमारोप्य तौ वीरौ जगाम कपिकुञ्जरः4.4.34।।
explanation: Hanuman, who was an elephant among monkeys, gave up the guise of a mendicant, and assuming the form of the monkeys, lifted both the heroes  on to his back and proceeded.

content: स तु विपुलयशाः कपिप्रवीरःपवनसुतः कृतकृत्यवत्प्रहृष्टः।गिरिवरमुरुविक्रमः प्रयातस्स शुभमतिस्सह रामलक्ष्मणाभ्याम्4.4.35।।
explanation: The son of the Windgod, the most valiant, the supremely heroic monkey and the one welladmired, having performed his task, felt immensely happy.And with an auspicious feeling, departed for the great mountain (Rishyamuka) along with Rama and Lakshmana.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किंधाकाण्डे चतुर्थस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fourth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Rama and Lakshmana meet Sugriva -- Rama makes friendship with him -- Sugriva reveals the injustice done to him by Vali -- Rama assures him help -- Sugriva promises to send his troops to find Sita.]ऋश्यमूकात्तु हनुमान्गत्वा तु मलयं गिरिम्।आचचक्षे तदा वीरौ कपिराजाय राघवौ4.5.1।।
explanation: Leaving Rishyamuka, Hanuman reached the Malaya mountain. Seeing the chief of monkeys there, he announced the arrival of  the heroic Raghavas.

content: अयं रामो महाप्राज्ञ स्सम्प्राप्तो दृढविक्रमः।लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा रामोऽयं सत्यविक्रमः4.5.2।।
explanation: 'This Rama of greatwisdom and valour, endowed with the power of truth has arrived here along with his brother Lakshmana.

content: इक्ष्वाकूणां कुले जातो रामो दशरथात्मजः।धर्मे निगदितश्चैव पितुर्निर्देशपारगः4.5.3।।
explanation: 'Born in the Ikshvaku race Rama Dasaratha's son, distinguished for his righteousness is here to carry out the orders of his father.

content: तस्यास्य वसतोऽरण्ये नियतस्य महात्मनः।रावणेन हृता भार्या स त्वां शरणमागतः4.5.4।।
explanation: 'While the great Rama armed with selfrestraint was living in the forest, his wife was abducted by Ravana. So he has come to you seeing refuge.

content: राजसूयाश्वमेधैश्च वह्निर्येनाभितर्पितः।दक्षिणाश्च तथोत्सृष्टा गावश्शतसहस्रशः4.5.5।।तपसा सत्यवाक्येन वसुधा येन पालिता।स्त्री हेतोस्तस्य पुत्रोऽयं रामस्त्वां शरणं गतः4.5.6।।
explanation: 'This Rama, son of a king who had gratified the firegod through many yajnas like  Rajasuya and Aswamedha, gifted hundreds of thousands of cows and ruled this earth with truth and austerity, has come seeking help for a woman.'

content: भवता सख्यकामौ तौ भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।प्रतिगृह्यार्चयस्वैतौ पूजनीयतमावुभौ4.5.7।।
explanation: 'Both the brothers, Rama and Lakshmana seek friendship with you. As both of them are worthiest of worship, welcome them with due reverence.'

content: श्रुत्वा हनुमतो वाक्यं सुग्रीवो हृष्टमानसः।भयं चराघवाद्घोरं प्रजहौ विगतज्वरः।।4.5.8।।सकृत्वा मानुषं रूपं सुग्रीवः प्लवगर्षभः।दर्शनीयतमो भूत्वा प्रीत्या प्रोवाच राघवम्4.5.9।।
explanation: Hanuman's words took away Sugriva's great fear for Rama and filled him with cheer. This bull among monkeys gave up his natural appearance and and assuming an attractive human form spoke to Rama lovingly:

content: भवान्धर्मविनीतश्च विक्रान्तस्सर्ववत्सलः।आख्याता वायुपुत्रेण तत्त्वतो मे भवद्गुणाः4.5.10।।
explanation: 'You are a great hero, affectionate to all and wellversed in all dharmas. The son of the Windgod has, in fact, apprised me  of your virtues

content: तन्ममैवैष सत्कारो लाभश्चैवोत्तमः प्रभो।यत्त्वमिच्छसि सौहार्दं वानरेण मया सह4.5.11।।
explanation: 'O Lord that you are eager to have friendship with me, who is a monkey is a great honour and is extremely beneficial to me.

content: रोचते यदि वा सख्यं बाहुरेष प्रसारितः।गृह्यतां पाणिना पाणिर्मर्यादा बध्यतां ध्रुवा4.5.12।।
explanation: 'If you are desirous of my friendship, here is my arm (palm) stretched out to you. With due regard, establish our bond firmly, holding my palm in yours.'

content: एतत्तु वचनं श्रुत्वा सुग्रीवेण सुभाषितम्।सम्प्रहृष्टमना हस्तं पीडयामास पाणिना4.5.13।।हृद्यं सौहृदमालम्ब्यपर्यष्वजत पीडितम्।
explanation: Rama became very happy to hear Sugriva's warm words and pressed his hand with his. Delighted, he went close  to Sugriva and hugged him tightly and  affectionately.

content: ततो हनूमान्सन्त्यज्य भिक्षुरूपमरिन्दमः।।4.5.14।।काष्ठयोस्स्वेन रूपेण जनयामास पावकम्।दीप्यमानं ततो वह्निं ह्निं पुष्पैरभ्यर्च्य सत्कृतम्4.5.15।।तयोर्मध्येऽथ सुप्रीतो निदधे सुसमाहितः।
explanation: Then, Hanuman vanquisher of enemies, gave up his guise of a mendicant, assumed his natural form and generated fire by rubbing two pieces of wood. Wellpleased at heart, he made an offering of flowers to the flaming fire and placed it between them.

content: ततोऽग्निं दीप्यमानं तौ चक्रतुश्च प्रदक्षिणम्।।4.5.16।।सुग्रीवो राघवश्चैव वयस्यत्वमुपागतौ।
explanation: They both circumambulated the blazing fire and solemnized their friendship.

content: ततस्सुप्रीतमनसौ तावुभौ हरिराघवौ4.5.17।।अन्योन्यमभिवीक्षन्तौ न तृप्तिमुपजग्मतुः।
explanation: Rama and the monkey contented at heart, yet not fully content, continued looking at each other.

content: त्वं वयस्योऽसि मे हृद्यो ह्येकं दुःखं सुखं च नौ4.5.18।।सुग्रीवो राघवं वाक्यमित्युवाच प्रहृष्टवत्।
explanation: 'You are a dear friend to me. Your sorrow is my sorrow, your pleasure is my  pleasure. We are one and the same' said Sugriva to Rama, his heart overflowing with happiness.

content: ततस्सुपर्णबहुलां छित्वा शाखां सुपुष्पिताम्4.5.19।।सालस्यास्तीर्य सुग्रीवो निषसाद सराघवः।
explanation: Then Sugriva cut the branch of a sala tree with luxuriant leaves and flowers, spread it on the ground and sat down along with Raghava.

content: लक्ष्मणायाथ संहृष्टो हनूमान् प्लवगर्षभः4.5.20।।शाखां चन्दनवृक्षस्य ददौ परमपुष्पिताम्।
explanation: Then Hanuman, the bull among monkeys, felt very happy, cut the branch of a sandalwood tree full of flowers and gave it to Lakshmana.

content: ततः प्रहृष्टस्सुग्रीवः श्लक्ष्णं मधुरया गिरा4.5.21।।प्रत्युवाच तदा रामं हर्षव्याकुललोचनः।
explanation: Then Sugriva, eyes sparkling with joy, replied to Rama in a sweet, gentle voice.

content: अहं विनिकृतो राम चरामीह भयार्दितः4.5.22।।हृतभार्यो वने त्रस्तो दुर्गमेतदुपाश्रितः।
explanation: 'O Rama, I have been insulted deeply and my wife hijacked. Stricken with fear I have taken refuge in this inaccessible forest.

content: सोऽहं त्रस्तो वने भीतो वसाम्युद्भ्रान्तचेतनः4.5.23।।वालिना निकृतो भ्रात्रा कृतवैरश्च राघव।
explanation: 'O Rama humiliated by my brother Vali, I have developed enmity with him. Terribly distraught and disturbed I live in this forest in great fear.

content: वालिनो मे महाभाग भयार्तस्याभयं कुरु4.5.24।।कर्तुमर्हसि काकुत्स्थ भयं मे न भवेद्यथा।
explanation: 'O reverend Kakutstha, I feel helpless with fear from Vali. Save me. You should release me free from fear.'

content: एवमुक्तस्तु तेजस्वी धर्मज्ञो धर्मवत्सलः4.5.25।।प्रत्यभाषत काकुत्स्थ: सुग्रीवं प्रहसन्निव।
explanation: The righteous and glorious Rama to whom dharma is very dear said to Sugriva with a gentle smile on his face, when he was entreated thus:

content: उपकारफलं मित्रं विदितं मे महाकपे4.5.26।।वालिनं तं वधिष्यामि तव भार्यापहारिणम्।
explanation: 'O great monkey I know friendship is the fruit of a beneficial deed. I will kill that Vali who has usurped your wife.

content: अमोघास्सूर्यसङ्काशा ममैते निशिताश्शराः4.5.27।।तस्मिन्वालिनि दुर्वृत्ते निपतिष्यन्ति वेगिताः।कङ्कपत्रप्रतिच्छन्ना महेन्द्राशनिसन्निभाः4.5.28।।तीक्ष्णाग्रा ऋजुपर्वाणस्सरोषा भुजगा इव।
explanation: 'These arrows covered with kanka feathers, sharp and straight at the tip, comparable to great Indra's thunderbolt are (burning bright) like the sun. Looking like angry serpents, they will unfailingly strike at the miscreant Vali soon.

content: तमद्य वालिनं पश्य तीक्ष्णैराशीविषोपमैः4.5.29।।शरैर्विनिहतं भूमौ विकीर्णमिव पर्वतम्।
explanation: 'With these sharp, serpentlike arrows Vali will be killed. He will fall down on the ground like a mountain shattered.You will see it now'.

content: स तु तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा राघवस्यात्मनो हितम्4.5.30।।सुग्रीवः परमप्रीतस्सुमहद्वाक्यमब्रवीत्।
explanation: Sugriva, very much pleased with the words of Rama, spoke highly (of him).

content: तव प्रसादेन नृसिंह राघवप्रियां च राज्यं च समाप्नुयामहम्। तथा कुरु त्वं नरदेव वैरिणंयथा निहंस्यद्य रिपुंममाग्रजम्4.5.31।।
explanation: 'O Rama, by your grace I will get my wife and kingdom back. O king accomplish this so that I can destroy my, elder brother, my enemy, O lion among men

content: सीता कपीन्द्रक्षणदाचराणांराजीवहेमज्वलनोपमानि।सुग्रीवरामप्रणयप्रसङ्गेवामानि नेत्राणि समं स्फुरन्ति4.5.32।।
explanation: While Sugriva was making a friendly alliance with Rama, Sita's left eye, like lotus, Vali's left eye glittering like gold and Ravana's left eye blazing (like fire) twitched at the same time for a moment (Twitching of left eye is considered auspicious to a woman and ominous to a man).इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे पञ्चमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fifth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Sugriva speaks about the abduction of Sita by Ravana -- shows to Rama the veil and ornament dropped down by Sita -- Rama eager to killl Ravana, seeks further details of the enemy from Sugriva]पुनरेवाब्रवीत्प्रीतो राघवं रघुनन्दनम्।अयमाख्याति मे राम सचिवो मन्त्रिसत्तमः4.6.1।।हनुमान्यन्निमित्तं त्वं निर्जनं वनमागतः।लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा वसतश्च वने तव4.6.2।।रक्षसाऽपहृता भार्या मैथिली जनकात्मजा।त्वया वियुक्ता रुदती लक्ष्मणेन च धीमता4.6.3।।अन्तरप्रेप्सुना तेन हत्वा गृध्रं जटायुषम्4.6.4।।
explanation: Sugriva was pleased to say to Rama, delight of the Raghu race once again, 'O Rama, Hanuman, jewel among Ministers, has told me the cause of your coming to this desolate forest. While you were residing in the forest, a demon who was looking for an opportunity carried off your wife, the princess from Mithila, daughter of Janaka, finding her alone. While she was crying (piteously) he killed Jatayu. (the vulture who pretested).

content: भार्यावियोगजं दुःखं न चिरात्त्वं विमोक्ष्यसे।अहं तामानयिष्यामि नष्टां वेदश्रुतीमिव।।4.6.5।।
explanation: 'Very soon you will be relieved of the grief caused by the separation from your wife. Just as Visnu retrieved the Vedas (carried away by the demons, Madhu and Kaitabha) I will deliver her to you.

content: रसातले वा वर्तन्तीं वर्तन्ती वा नभस्थलेअहमानीय दास्यामि तव भार्यामरिन्दम।।।4.6.6।।
explanation: 'O subduer of enemies I will restore her to you even if she is kept in the bowels of the earth or in the vaults of heaven.

content: इदं तथ्यं मम वचस्त्वमवेहि च राघव।न शक्या सा जरयितुं सेन्द्रैरपि स्सुरासुरैः4.6.7।।तव भार्या महाबाहो भक्ष्यं विषकृतं यथा।त्यज शोकं महाबाहो तां कान्तामानयामि ते4.6.8।।
explanation: 'O longarmed Rama, take these words of mine as true. Your consort cannot be absorbed with impunity even by the denizens of heaven including Indra or the ogres on earth any more than food cooked with poison.Give up grief.

content: अनुमानात्तु जानामि मैथिली सा न संशयः।ह्रियमाणा मया दृष्टा रक्षसा क्रूरकर्मणा4.6.9।।क्रोशन्ती राम रामेति लक्ष्मणेति च विस्वरम्।स्फुरन्ती रावणस्याङ्के पन्नगेन्द्रवधूर्यथा4.6.10।।
explanation: 'Yes, I remember. I had observed a lady being carried away by a wicked demon. She was crying loudly 'Oh, Rama Oh Rama Oh Lakshmana' in a husky voice. It was Maithili. She was wriggling on the lap of Ravana like a female serpent.

content: आत्मना पञ्चमं मां हि दृष्ट्वा शैलतटे स्थितम्।उत्तरीयं तया त्यक्तं शुभान्याभरणानि च4.6.11।।
explanation: 'Seeing me as the fifth member seated on a mountain  she dropped down the auspicious ornaments (bundled) in her veil

content: तान्यस्माभिगृहीतानि निहितानि च राघव।आनयिष्याम्यहं तानि प्रत्यभिज्ञातुमर्हसि4.6.12।।
explanation: 'Rama, we have kept  them safely. I will fetch them so that you should be able to identify them.'

content: तमब्रवीत्ततो रामस्सुग्रीवं प्रियवादिनम्।आनयस्व सखे शीघ्रं किमर्थं प्रविलम्बसे4.6.13।।
explanation: Rama then said to Sugriva, one who used pleasing words, 'O my friend why delay? Get them here immediately'.

content: एवमुक्तस्तु सुग्रीवश्शैलस्य गहनां गुहाम्।प्रविवेश ततशशीघ्रं राघवप्रियकाम्यया4.6.14।।
explanation: On hearing this, Sugriva at once entered into the deep cave of the mountain (to get the ornaments and veil) in order to please Rama.

content: उत्तरीयं गृहीत्वा तु शुभान्याभरणानि च।इदं पश्येति रामाय दर्शयामास वानरः4.6.15।।
explanation: That monkey brought out the veil and auspicios ornaments, showed them to Rama and said, 'Please, see.'

content: ततो गृहीत्वा वासस्तु श्शुभान्याभरणानि च।अभवद्बाष्पसंरुद्धो नीहारेणेव चन्द्रमाः4.6.16।।
explanation: Holding the raiment  as well as the ornaments,  Rama's  eyes were filled with tears.He appeared like the Moon covered with dews.

content: सीतास्नेहप्रवृत्तेन स तु बाष्पेण दूषितः।हा प्रियेति रुदन्धैर्यमुत्सृज्य न्यपतत्क्षितौ4.6.17।।
explanation: On account of his deep attachment for Sita, he shed profuse tears. Unable to maintain his natural composure, he sank down to the ground, saying 'O my darling Sita' and cried inconsolably

content: हृदि कृत्वा तु बहुशस्तमलङ्कारमुत्तमम्।निशश्वास भृशं सर्पो बिलस्थ इव रोषितः।।4.6.18।।
explanation: Pressing the excellent ornaments to his bosom again and again Rama hissed like a cobra provoked in its anthill.

content: अविच्छिन्नाश्रुवेगस्तु सौमित्रिं वीक्ष्य पार्श्वतः।परिदेवयितुं दीनं रामस्समुपचक्रमे4.6.19।।
explanation: Rama began to wail piteously while tears streamed down his eyes incessantly. He looked at Saumitri standing by his side and said:

content: पश्य लक्ष्मण वैदेह्या सन्त्यक्तं ह्रियमाणया।उत्तरीयमिदं भूमौ शरीराद्भूषणानि च4.6.20।।
explanation: 'O Lakshmana, behold the veil and the ornaments dropped on the ground by Vaidehi while she was being abducted.

content: शाद्वलिन्यां ध्रुवं भूमौ सीतया ह्रियमाणया।उत्सृष्टं भूषणमिदं तथारूपं हि दृश्यते4.6.21।।
explanation: 'Sita, for sure, dropped these ornaments on the grassy ground. They are in good shape (without any damage).

content: एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण लक्ष्मणो वाक्यमब्रवीत्।नाहं जानामि केयूरे नाहं जानामि कुण्डले4.6.22।।नूपुरे त्वभिजानामि नित्यं पादाभिवन्दनात्।
explanation: Thus addressed by Rama, Lakshmana replied, 'I recognise neither the armlets nor the earrings. I only recognise the anklets as I used to bow at her feet daily.'

content: ततस्तु राघवो वाक्यं सुग्रीवमिदमब्रवीत्4.6.23।।ब्रूहि सुग्रीव कं देशं ह्रियन्ती लक्षिता त्वया।रक्षसा रौद्ररूपेण मम प्राणैः प्रिया प्रिया4.6.24।।
explanation: Then Rama said to Sugriva,.'Tell me, O Sugriva, to which region that fiercelooking demon has carried away my Sita, who is dearer than my life.

content: क्व वा वसति तद्रक्षो महद्व्यसनदं मम।यन्निमित्तमहं सर्वान्नाशयिष्यामि राक्षसान्4.6.25।।
explanation: 'Let me know where dwells that huge  ogre who has caused this agony to me. I will exterminate all the demons

content: हरता मैथिलीं येन मां च रोषयता भृशम्।आत्मनो जीवितान्ताय मृत्युद्वारमपावृतम्4.6.26।।
explanation: 'By abducting Maithili he has stirred my fierce anger and has opened the door of his death.

content: मम दयिततरा हृता वनान्ताद्रजनिचरेण विमथ्य येन सा।कथय मम रिपुं तमद्य वैप्लवगपते यमसादनं नयामि4.6.27।।
explanation: 'O lord of monkeys tell me the whereabouts of that nightranger who has carried off my darling from the heart of the forest and has harassed her. I will send him now to the abode of Death.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे षष्ठस्सर्गःThus ends the sixth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana,  the first epic, composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Sugriva promises to kill Ravana and bring Sita back -- he consoles Rama -- Rama promises to kill Vali.]एवमुक्तस्तु सुग्रीवो रामेणार्तेन वानरः।अब्रवीत्प्राञ्जलिर्वाक्यं सबाष्पं बाष्पगद्गदः।।4.7.1।।
explanation: On hearing the words of Rama in deep distress, the monkey replied to him with folded hands, his throat choked with tears:

content: न जाने निलयं तस्य सर्वथा पापरक्षसः।सामर्थ्यं विक्रमं वापि दौष्कुलेयस्य वा कुलम्4.7.2।।
explanation: 'I do not have any knowledge of this sinful demon's dwelling , his capability, his valour or his clan or his despicable lineage.

content: सत्यं ते प्रतिजानामि त्यज शोकमरिन्दम।करिष्यामि तथा यत्नं यथा प्राप्स्यसि मैथिलीम्4.7.3।।
explanation: 'O subduer of enemies, give up sorrow. I promise I will make necessary effort so that you will obtain the princess from Mithila.

content: रावणं सगणं हत्वा परितोष्यात्मपौरुषम्।तथाऽस्मि कर्ता न चिराद्यथा प्रीतो भविष्यसि4.7.4।।
explanation: 'With all my capability I will kill Ravana and his clan. Thus I will be able to satisfy you soon with my efforts.

content: अलं वैक्लब्यमालम्ब्य धैर्यमात्मगतं स्मर।त्वद्विधानां न सदृशमीदृशं बुद्धिलाघवम्।।4.7.5।।
explanation: 'Give up despair. It is enough. Be patient. Maintain your natural disposition.It is unworthy of men like you to entertain such frivolus thoughts?

content: मयाऽपि व्यसनं प्राप्तं भार्याविरहजं महत्।नाहमेवं हि शोचामि न च धैर्यं परित्यजे4.7.6।।
explanation: 'Separated from my wife, I, too, am afflicted with deep grief. But I do not brood, I do not lose patience.

content: नाहं तामनुशोचामि प्राकृतो वानरोऽपि सन्।महात्मा च विनीतश्च किं पुनर्धृतिमान्भवान्4.7.7।।
explanation: 'I am an ordinary monkey born. Even then, I do not brood over my wife. You are highsouled, humble and patient. Why do you grieve?

content: बाष्पमापतितं धैर्यान्निग्रहीतुं त्वमर्हसि।मर्यादां सत्त्वयुक्तानां धृतिं नोत्स्रष्टुमर्हसि4.7.8।।
explanation: 'Restrain the flow of your tears. Be  patient. Men (like you) endowed with  equilibrium and dignity and patience ought not to leave their composure.

content: व्यसने वाऽर्थकृच्छ्रे वा भये वा जीवितान्तके।विमृशन्वै स्वया बुद्ध्या धृतिमान्नावसीदति4.7.9।।
explanation: 'In times of grief or loss of wealth or at the hour of death, one who is patient does not abandon his wisdom, he does not despair.

content:
बालिशस्तु नरो नित्यं वैक्लब्यं योऽनुवर्तते।

स मज्जत्यवशश्शोके भाराक्रान्तेव नौर्जले4.7.10।।
explanation: A man who is unwise and distraught only gets sunk in grief like a heavily loaded boat (sinks) in water.

content: एषोऽञ्जलिर्मया बद्धः प्रणयात्त्वां प्रसादये।पौरुषं श्रय शोकस्य नान्तरं दातुमर्हसि4.7.11।।
explanation: 'I implore you with folded palms on account of our friendship to show manliness. You should not give in to grief.

content: ये शोकमनुवर्तन्ते न तेषां विद्यते सुखम्।तेजश्च क्षीयते तेषां न त्वं शोचितुमर्हसि4.7.12।।
explanation: 'There is no happiness for those who give way to sorrow. Their brilliance is dimmed. Therefore, you ought not grieve.

content: शोकेनाभिप्रपन्नस्य जीविते चापि संशयः।स शोकं त्यज राजेन्द्र धैर्यमाश्रय केवलम्4.7.13।।
explanation: 'Even the chances of survival are doubtful for a man who is overpowered by sorrow. Give up sorrow and have patience, O king

content: हितं वयस्यभावेन ब्रूमि नोपदिशामि ते।वयस्यतां पूजयन्मे न त्वं शोचितुमर्हसि4.7.14।।
explanation: 'Out of friendly concern I offer my opinion in your interest. I am not competent to advise you. Respecting my friendship, you should never yield to grief.'

content: मधुरं सान्त्वित स्तेन सुग्रीवेण स राघवः।मुखमश्रुपरिक्लिन्नं वस्त्रान्तेन प्रमार्जयत्4.7.15।।
explanation: Consoled by the sweet words of Sugriva, Rama wiped his face filled with tears by the hem of his upper cloth.

content: प्रकृतिस्थस्तु काकुत्स्थस्सुग्रीववचनात्प्रभुः।सम्परिष्वज्य सुग्रीवमिदं वचनमब्रवीत्4.7.16।।
explanation: When lord Rama, the scion of the Kakutstha race was comforted by these words of Sugriva, he came to his senses, and clasping him said:

content: कर्तव्यं यद्वयस्येन स्निग्धेन च हितेन च।अनुरूपं च युक्तं च कृतं सुग्रीव तत्त्वया4.7.17।।
explanation: 'O Sugriva you have done what a friend should have done in a befitting manner with your sweet words and good wishes.

content: एष च प्रकृतिस्थोऽहमनुनीतस्त्वया सखे।दुर्लभो हीदृशो बन्धुरस्मिन्काले विशेषतः4.7.18।।
explanation: 'O friend you have guided me back to my senses thus. It is difficult to find a friend like you specially at this time.

content: किं तु यत्नस्त्वया कार्यो मैथिल्याः परिमार्गणे।राक्षसस्य च रौद्रस्य रावणस्य दुरात्मनः4.7.19।।
explanation: 'Indeed, you must make effort to trace the princess from Mithila and the evilminded, fierce  demon Ravana.

content: मया च यदनुष्ठेयं विस्रब्धेन तदुच्यताम्।वर्षास्विव च सुक्षेत्रे सर्वं सम्पद्यते तव4.7.20।।
explanation: 'Now tell me about my duty without any hesitation. I assure you that your desire will be fulfilled, just as seeds sown in a fertile land with timely rains bear fruit.

content: मया च यदिदं वाक्यमभिमानात्समीरितम्।तत्त्वया हरिशार्दूल तत्त्वमित्युपधार्यताम्4.7.21।।
explanation: 'O tiger amongst monkeys accept my words uttered out of injured honour in their true sense.

content: अनृतं नोक्तपूर्वं मे न च वक्ष्ये कदाचन।एतत्ते प्रतिजानामि सत्येनैव च ते शपाम्यहमं।।4.7.22।।
explanation: 'I have never uttered a false word earlier nor will I do it in future. This is my promise. I swear by truth alone.'

content: ततः प्रहृष्टस्सुग्रीवो वानरैस्सचिवैस्सह।राघवस्य वचश्श्रुत्वा प्रतिज्ञातं विशेषतः4.7.23।।
explanation: Sugriva and his counsellors felt glad on hearing Rama's words, particularly  the assurance given by him.

content: एवमेकान्तसम्पृक्तौ ततस्तौ नरवानरौ।उभावन्योन्यसदृशं सुखं दुःखमभाषताम्4.7.24।।
explanation: Man and monkey then met privately and shared the weal and woe of one another.

content: महानुभावस्य वचो निशम्यहरिर्नृपाणामृषभस्य तस्य।कृतं स मेने हरिवीरमुख्यस्तदा स्वकार्यं हृदयेन विद्वान्4.7.25।।
explanation: Wise Sugriva, chief of monkeys, heard the words of the magnanimous Rama, a bull among men. He felt glad at heart thinking that his task has been achieved.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे सप्तमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventh sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by the sage Valmiki.

content: [Sugriva feels happy about his friendship with Rama -- solicits Vali's death -- relates to Rama about Vali's hostile attitude and his enmity with him.]परितुष्टस्तु सुग्रीवस्तेन वाक्येन वानरः।लक्ष्मणस्याग्रतो राममिदं वचनमब्रवीत्4.8.1।।
explanation: Sugriva, the monkey was very pleased with Rama's words and said to him in front of Lakshmana:

content: सर्वथाऽहमनुग्राह्यो देवतानां न संशयः।उपपन्न गुणोपेतस्सखा यस्य भवान्मम4.8.2।।
explanation: 'Since one like you endowed with all virtues has become my friend I am (now) worthy of grace of the gods in all respects. There is no doubt.

content: शक्यं खलु भवेद्राम सहायेन त्वयाऽनघ।सुरराज्यमपि प्राप्तुं स्वराज्यं किं पनः प्रभो 4.8.3।।
explanation: 'O Rama, my sinless Lord, it is possible to attain even the kingdom of the gods with your help, what  to speak of my own kingdom?

content: सोऽहं सभाज्यो बन्धूनां सुहृदां चैव राघव।यस्याग्निसाक्षिकं मित्रं लब्धं राघववंशजम्4.8.4।।
explanation: 'O Rama, since you, born in Raghava dynasty, have become my friend with fire as witness, I have become equally honourable among my relatives and friends.

content: अहमप्यनुरूपस्ते वयस्यो ज्ञास्यसे शनैः।न तु वक्तुं समर्थोऽहं स्वयमात्मगतान्गुणान्4.8.5।।
explanation: 'You will come to know slowly that I am also a friend worthy of you.It is not proper for me to speak of my qualities( flatter myself).

content: महात्मनां तु भूयिष्ठं त्वद्विधानां कृतात्मनाम्।निश्चला भवति प्रीतिर्धैर्यमात्मवतामिव4.8.6।।
explanation: 'The affection of exalted souls is exceedingly stable like the patience of  selfcontrolled and wellcomposed men like you.

content: रजतं वा सुवर्णं वा वस्त्राण्याभरणानि च।अविभक्तानि साधूनामवगच्छन्ति साधवः4.8.7।।
explanation: 'Good friends consider(valuables such as) silver or gold, clothes or ornaments of worldly wealth indivisible.

content: आढ्यो वापि दरिद्रो वा दुःखितस्सुखितोऽपि वा।निर्दोषो वा सदोषो वा वयस्यः परमा गतिः4.8.8।।
explanation: 'Whether rich or poor, afflicted or happy, flawless or guilty, a friend is the ultimate refuge to a friend.

content: धनत्यागस्सुखत्यागो देहत्यागोऽपि वा पुनः।वयस्यार्थे प्रवर्तन्ते स्नेहं दृष्टवा तथाविधम्4.8.9।।
explanation: 'One will not hesitate to sacrifice wealth or happiness or even life for the sake of a friend like you.'

content: तत्तथेत्यब्रवीद्रामस्सुग्रीवं प्रियवादिनम्।     	लक्ष्मणस्याग्रतो लक्ष्म्या वासवस्येव धीमतः4.8.10।।
explanation: As wise Lakshmana, brilliant like Indra stood witness, Rama said, 'it is true as you say' to Sugriva who spoke pleasing words.

content: ततो रामं स्थितं दृष्ट्वा लक्ष्मणं च महाबलम्।सुग्रीवस्सर्वतश्चक्षुर्वने लोलमपातयत्4.8.11।।
explanation: With mighty Rama and Lakshmana standing by, Sugriva cast his eyes eagerly all round the forest.

content: स ददर्श ततस्सालमविदूरे हरीश्वरः।सुपुष्पमीषत्पत्राढ्यं भ्रमरैरुपशोभितम्4.8.12।।
explanation: Then the chief of monkeys saw a sala tree looking lovely with tender leaves and flowers graced by bees.

content: तस्यैकां पर्णबहुलां भङ्क्त्वा शाखां सुपुष्पिताम्।सालस्यास्तीर्य सुग्रीवो निषसाद सराघवः4.8.13।।
explanation: Sugriva cut a branch of the beautifully blossomed sala tree with plenty of leaves,   spread it (on the ground) and squatted along with Rama.

content: तावासीनौ ततो दृष्ट्वा हनूमानपि लक्ष्मणम्।सालशाखां समुत्पाट्य विनीतमुपवेशयत्4.8.14।।
explanation: Thereafter Hanuman also broke a branch of the sala tree and seated Lakshmana on it.

content: सुखोपविष्टं रामं तु प्रसन्नमुदधिं यथा।फलपुष्पसमाकीर्णे तस्मिन् गिरिवरोत्तमे4.8.15।।ततः प्रहृष्टस्सुग्रीवश्लक्ष्णं मधुरया गिरा।उवाच प्रणयाद्रामं हर्षव्याकुलिताक्षरम्4.8.16।।
